Por eso,es una lastima que encontr√© descuidada la limpieza en la habitaci√≥n...y en general en el resto del hotel.
Tiene un patio arabe precioso...pero algo descuidado y se palpaba una falta de personal en los detalles...(tazas olvidadas indefinidamente...fuente seca...)

Buena limpieza. En general, acogedora y c√≥moda. Por decir algo negativo, deber√≠an ver la posibilidad de cambiar las cortinas existentes por otras que impidan que entre la claridad por la ma√±ana. La habitaci√≥n tambi√©n tiene mini bar, aunque los precios nos parecieron excesivos. Personal muy atento y profesional. Destacar el amplio jard√≠n y su piscina. El parking que tiene de pago por 6,50 ‚Ç¨ al d√≠a. Tambi√©n hay un restaurant La Taula, del cual no podemos hablar de el porque no comimos o cenamos. Es un hotel con exteriores agradables pero estropeados; habitaciones amplias pero feas y antiguas. La comida es solamente regular, platos precocinados y sacados de la c√°mara a una temperatura inadecuada, arroces pasados, vinos muy malos...

Muy cerca del centro (5 minutos andando). La piscina ten√≠a muy buena pinta (aunque no la prob√©) y, por √∫ltimo, el hotel tiene una terraza encima de la entrada principal ideal para leer un libro y tener una estampa inigualable del palmeral al atardecer.
Adem√°s, desde el palmeral donde est√° el hotel puedes acceder a 2 rutas que han hecho para recorrer los palmerales de Elche: una cortita (2,5 kms.) y la otra (que es la que recomiendo, si tienes tiempo), de unos 12 Kms: muy divertida ya que es como seguir una pista de rastreo y pasa por todos los palmerales de Elche y por el r√≠o que cruza la ciudad.

Nuestra estancia en el Hotel fue muy agradable ya que est√° en frente del palmeral de Elche y est√° rodeado de bellos y cuidados jardines. Las habitaciones son amplias y el estilo colonial del hotel me gust√≥ mucho. El desayuno es adecuado y el restaurante La Taula muy elegante y con buena relaci√≥n calidad/precio. Muy recomendable.

Estuvimos de viernes noche a domingo. Nuestra habitaci√≥n era amplia y acogedora, el ba√±o impecable pero lo mejor de todo la comodidad de la cama. HAc√≠a tiempo que no descansaba tan bien en un hotel.

Por otro lado el buffet desayuno tambi√©n excelente y con muy buena relaci√≥n calidad-precio. Muy buena experiencia y muy recomendable.

Soy viajero asiduo a este hotel y la relaci√≥n calidad - precio, sobre los 70 euros por noche, el trato y la ubicacion hacen que para mi no tenga rival en la ciudad. es del grupo Huerto del Cura que tienen un hotel mucho mejor pero en ese si que el precio para mi se dispara.

En general el Hotel pasa el notable, gracias al servicio la limpieza y el entorno.
Quiz√°s est√° m√°s cerca de un tres estrellas.
La habitaci√≥n nuestra estaba orientada al patio interior y era muy tranquila, situada en la primera planta.
Muy espaciosa, quiz√°s corta de armario si vas para varios d√≠as.
Demasiada ba√±era y peligros√≠sima, ten√≠as que entrar con sumo cuidado y eso que parece ser las tratan con un producto antideslizante.
Los accesos desde el parking con maletas son algo complicados, sobre todo el tramo final de escalones para llegar a recepci√≥n que tiene instaladas dos planchas tipo v√≠as de tren que si te sales, conflicto.
Coincido con algunos comentarios de clientes sobre el precio del parking, precio elevado para ser en el exterior y teniendo en cuenta que tienes un paseo de 15' hasta llegar a zona del centro.
La zona de sol√°rium, gimnasio y sauna deber√≠an anularla o mejorarla ya que s√≠ que es cierto que no invita a utilizarla.
Como dec√≠a al principio mi nota es un notable (7,5), creo que pueden mejorarse algunas cosas y gracias al personal de servicio por su agilidad y buen hacer en resolver las peque√±as incidencias.

Me ha dejado descolocado este hotel, por un lado si analizamos el hotel en si... bastante mejorable,aunque correctas las habitaciones y amplias, est√°n un poco anticuadas y las instalaciones(Gimnasio...) mejor no comentar muy pobres. Sin embargo los exteriores ,el restaurante y el buffet est√°n fenomenal. Tambi√©n destacar el trato fant√°stico del personal.

Hotel muy agradable en una zona muy tranquila. Aunque hemos ido aun en invierno imagino que en el jard√≠n en verano por la noche se debe estar muy bien.
A la vez cerca del centro que si te gusta caminar puedes ir a pasear y ver las zonas tur√≠sticas sin mover el coche.

El hotel es ideal para el verano, ya que tiene una buena piscina y jard√≠n. No est√° muy lejos del centro de la ciudad, dando un peque√±o paseo llegas a √©l. Rodeado de palmeras y al lado de la ruta del palmeral donde poder pasear.
La habitaci√≥n en la que estuvimos era muy amplia. Ibamos con dos ni√±os y hab√≠a sitio para la cama supletoria, la cuna y los juguetes. El ba√±o ten√≠a una ducha amplia y ba√±era.
Adem√°s de la cafeter√≠a-restaurante del hotel dentro del recinto hay otro restaurante.

Hemos estado dos veces en el hotel, por una boda y por una cena de San Valent√≠n, que fueron una estupenda experiencia, con un resultado excelente, de habitabilidad y de acogimiento; esta vez fue un viaje espor√°dico individual y sigue en su misma l√≠nea y mejorando todo, las habitaciones perfectas, los servicios de comedor y cafeter√≠a muy bien y a destacar las atenciones de TODO el personal de servicio que se desvive para que tengas una estancia agradable y sosegada. El marco,en medio del palmeral, ayuda a todo lo expresado.

Preciosos jardines y precioso lugar, apartado del mundanal ruido. La habitaci√≥n muy normal y poca intimidad debido a lo finas que son las paredes ya que se oye absolutamente todo.
El restaurante excepcional, buen trato y muy buen servicio.

Hotel de 4 estrellas sin habitaciones superiores. Situado enfrente de un palmeral. Buena calidad de sus instalaciones. Habitaciones francamente amplias. Preferibles las orientadas hacia su jard√≠n interior para evitar el ruido (no exajerado) de los coches que circulan por la calle. Personal muy amable. Cafeter√≠a con servicio lento.

Nos alojamos de m√≠nimo 3 veces al a√±o en este Hotel, ya que tenemos familia en Elche y cuando vamos casi siempre vamos a este, para ir con ni√±os est√° muy bien, las habitaciones son amplias cosa que se agradece mucho, la limpieza correcta.
Como pegas dir√≠a que ya que llevamos a√±os aloj√°ndonos en este hotel guardaran nuestros datos y no cada vez que vayamos nos pregunten: se han alojado antes aqu√≠? Nos hace mucha gracia cada vez que nos lo preguntan.
Otra pega es que casi siempre pedimos cena en la habitaci√≥n y la calidad es muy regular, esta √∫ltima vez las patatas ol√≠an a aceite recalentado, el jam√≥n (supuestamente ib√©rico) cortado muy gordo para un bocadillo fatal.
Lo dem√°s bastante bien la verdad, el entorno es bonito, tranquilo, tiene parking y el centro a 10 minutos andando, de precio muy bien tambi√©n. Mejorar√≠a cosas pero en general s√≠ lo recomendar√≠a.

titulo: Fatal!!! Mal descanso!!! Paredes Ultrafinas! Colchon antiguo y sin OSCURIDAD, cortinas transparentes!!! Mal descanso!!!
conteudo:
Hotel anticuado.
Con paredes que se escucha hablar perfectamente normal a cualquier habitaci√≥n colindante.
No puedes dormir a Oscuras!!! Cortinas trasparentes que por la ma√±ana entra el sol!!!
Colch√≥n antiguo que se clavan los muelles en la espalda!
Mala atenci√≥n al cliente.
Mala gesti√≥n de reservas donde pides una cama de matrimonio y te ponen 2 camas juntas!!
Camas sucias, arrugadas y mal planchadas!
Lavabos sucios, con pelos y trozos???, con baldosas ennegrecidas.
SIN JAB√ìN!!! Ni de Manos ni de Ducha!!!
Suelo fri√≥ de cer√°mica vieja y de mala calidad.
Llaves de la habitaci√≥n que no van, tuve que reactivar 2 veces la llave antes de entrar en la habitaci√≥n y una despu√©s al volver al hotel y me echaron la culpa a mi!
Te cobran 6,5‚Ç¨ por d√≠a el parking del hotel.
Tratan tus descontentos y deficiencias del hotel como problemas tuyos, de una manera muy poco profesional y poco amigable.
Televisi√≥n peque√±a y apartada de la cama, con un mando a distancia con pocas pilas que le cuesta encender.
Habitaci√≥n fea y √°cida! mal decorada donde predomina un color verde en el mobiliario y amarillo √°cido en las paredes. Incomoda para parejas.
L√°mparas sin interruptor de pared. Oblig√°ndote a agacharte y a desplazarte para apagar las luces cuando vas a dormir.
Fatal de calidad / precio.
Anticuado y descuidado.
NO PIENSO VOLVER!

No esta mal. Las habitaciones son buenas, pero yo creo que est√° entre bien y normal. No es caro, y el lugar donde se encuentra es precioso. Los jardines muy bonitos. Lo que si tiene muy bueno es el restaurante. ¬°que arroz! y en general todo bueno y bien atendido. S√≠ volveria.

No volver√© al hotel le hace falta una reforma profunda, tanto en la habitaci√≥n como en el ba√±o, y tambi√©n las instalaciones del hotel, por no hablar de la cama estaba muy antigua y en general ol√≠a a humedad en el edificio

La verdad que es injusto criticar un hotel por lo que yo lo har√© ahora, teniendo en cuenta las instalaciones, el personal y los servicios, pero teniendo en cuenta que hay personas que nos alojamos para trabajar, tampoco ser√≠a justo que solo dijese las cosas buenas de los sitios donde me hospedo‚Ä¶ Buen hotel, amplias estancias, pasillos, habitaciones y ba√±os, buen restaurante y muy buena atenci√≥n, personal agradable, profesional y siempre dispuesto a echar una mano. El principal y creo que √∫nico problema es la poca insonorizaci√≥n de las habitaciones. Si se ducha el de arriba lo escuchas, si el que va o viene de su habitaci√≥n por el pasillo, lo escuchas y las habitaciones contiguas, las escuchas‚Ä¶ otra cosa que creo que podr√≠an mejorar, es el precio del parking exterior, 6‚Ç¨ la estancia de una noche teniendo en cuenta la caminata que hay que pegarse hasta recepci√≥n y que es exterior, lo veo un poco caro. Creo que dependiendo de la tarifa a aplicar, deber√≠a estar incluido.

Estuvimos en este hotel hace 2 a√±os y repet√≠amos por lo mucho que nos gust√≥, el sitio aporta mucha tranquilidad y para ser un 4* de precio no est√° mal. Pero nos hemos encontrado con un hotel venido a menos y una media pensi√≥n decepcionante. En primer lugar nos toc√≥ una habitaci√≥n que daba a la carretera y ha resultado ser muy ruidosa y la ba√±era se inundaba. En segundo lugar, sobre la media pensi√≥n, nos hemos encontrado con luces y sombras en el men√∫, pero para rematar, el hotel nos dijo y nos repiti√≥ hasta en 3 ocasiones que a√∫n teniendo media pensi√≥n y habiendo cenado la noche de entrada y desayunado el d√≠a de salida, nos entraba tambi√©n la comida de ese d√≠a. Agradecidos y sorprendidos decidimos pasar esa ma√±ana en Elche en vez de irnos a las playas y comer por all√≠, nuestra sorpresa al volver ha sido que no nos entraba la comida, era un error de la gente de recepci√≥n. Vamos, que nos han fastidiado el √∫ltimo d√≠a de vacaciones. Ah! Cuidado que en la media pensi√≥n no incluyen la bebida y te clavan en el precio pero bien.

titulo: No lo veo como cuatro estrellas
conteudo: Es un hotel de habitaciones amplias, pero los acabados y detalles son de tres estrellas seg√∫n mi experiencia en hoteles de tres y cuatro estrellas. Las paredes son de papel, los ba√±os son un poco antiguos, y los colchones de las camas un poco duros. La cama supletoria un poco floja, para ser un cuatro estrellas. Y un desprop√≥sito el que te cobren seis euros por d√≠a si quieres tener el coche en el parking del hotel que encima es descubierto. El trato del personal es correcto y la limpieza tambi√©n.

Estuvimos hospedados unos d√≠as y la estancia fue increible.El hotel es peque√±o pero muy acogedor y el personal muy atento y amable, te hacen sentir como en casa.Las habitaciones son muy amplias y las camas muy c√≥modas.Se agradecer√≠a tambi√©n que en la ba√±era tuvieran mampara en vez de cortinas, a√∫n as√≠ el cuarto de ba√±o esta muy bien y es enorme.El restaurante la Taula,que pertenece al hotel,es excelente.Como inconvenientes, el aire acondicionado de la cafeter√≠a tiene poca potencia y se pasa calor.Decoraci√≥n del hotel es sencilla,sin m√°s

Recomendable hotel, bien situado en el centro de Elche. Amplias habitaciones. Destaca la calidad de la atenci√≥n al cliente y el bonito jard√≠n de palmeras. El desayuno podr√≠a mejorarse, pero es aceptable. Dispone de un buen parking propio. Hotel limpio.

Estuvimos mi familia y yo 4 dias en este hotel, y la verdad, tiene encanto. Esta muy limpio y cuidado. Nos alojamos en septiembre 2014, por una boda en HUERTO DEL CURA, y sin duda, volver√≠amos. El palmeral de Elche, recomendable , y el centro encantador...fueron unos d√≠as muy buenos. Recomendado.

Cogimos este hotel para una noche y nos enamor√≥. Me dio pena no poder quedarme alg√∫n d√≠a m√°s. Precioso, limpio, acorde a su p√°gina web... Los alrededores son maravillosos y el centro de Elche a un paso. Dando un peque√±o y bonito paseo de 10 minutos.
El trato con el personal, muy acertado. Gente profesional y atenta. Camareros y recepcionistas nos alegraron el d√≠a y nos hicieron sentir como en casa. Gracias.
Sin duda, volveremos.

Hotel muy recomendable. Bonito entorno, el restaurante estupendo. El personal muy amable.
Lo √∫nico negativo fue el ruido que se oia en la habitaci√≥n. Teniamos unos vecinos con ni√±os peque√±os que no pararon de llorar en toda la noche.

titulo: Hotel con encanto practicamente en el centro de Elche
conteudo: Trato muy amable y servicio impecable. Limpieza en todo el hotel. Genial para descansar o para ir a la playa (estupendas playas a menos de 20 kms.) Bufet muy bueno (solo hicimos desayuno) y restaurante en la misma huerta (pues as√≠ se llaman los palmerales de Elche) de alto standing, con carta de gran calidad.

Estuvimos mi pareja y yo hace 4 a√±os en este hotel y celebramos nuestro aniversario y quedamos encantados tanto por recepci√≥n como, por el desayuno, por habitaci√≥n y sobre todo por el restaurante La taula. Sin embargo estuvimos hace un par de semanas y me decepcion√≥ el ba√±o limpionpero con falta de retoques como la ba√±era muy desgastada, no funcionaba bien el aacc estuvimos pasando calor hasta que vino el de mantenimiento y ni una disculpa, el desayuno ni la mitad de cuando fuimos la otra vez, y el restaurante lo √∫nico que me encant√≥ el jam√≥n ib√©rico, poca variedad en carta, pedimos pulpo al carb√≥n y estaba durisimo y el mojo la verdad que no le acompa√±a nada, el vino estaba super caliente, no estaba a temperatura para degustar en absoluto, y el servicio nada que ver, hace cuatro a√±os nos trataron con total elegancia y esta veznparecia que est√°bamos en el bar paco, espero que esto sirva para mejorar parques una aut√©ntica lastima

Hemos estado este fin de semana, la verdad q no ha estado nada mal pero hay cositas q tendr√≠an q mejorar por ejemplo la piscina tendr√≠an q limpiar la coronaci√≥n y las terrazas no tiene sentido obligaci√≥n de ducharte antes de entrar y en el transcurso de tirarte a la piscina te lleves toda la suciedad dentro. El trato del personal muy agradables.

Simplemente genial.
Nos encant√≥ todo, el trato, el servicio y las instalaciones.
Desde que llegamos hasta que nos fuimos estuvimos como en casa.
El personal muy amable y muy atento a todo lo que necesit√°bamos.

Es un hotel algo alejado del centro, pero tambi√©n su precio es algo inferior.
La zona es muy tranquila con un parque en frente.
Servicio correcto, habitaci√≥n amplia, aunque no es muy acogedora quiz√°s por el suelo que es de baldosas.
El parking aunque cerrado, me pareci√≥ caro para ser al aire libre.
Pr√°ctico para un par de d√≠as de visita a la ciudad.

titulo: Pr√°ctico, confortable y en pleno Palmeral
conteudo:
Hotel funcional, bien mantenido y con habitaciones muy amplias. Servicios correctos en cuanto a limpieza, cafeter√≠a, recepci√≥n y atenci√≥n al cliente en general. Dispone de una buena piscina exterior muy aprovechable en verano. Se echaba en falta algo m√°s de mobiliario para la piscina (hamacas, sombrillas, alguna mesita, ...).
Ubicaci√≥n muy tranquila a 15 minutos de paseo hasta el centro hist√≥rico.
Buen restaurante ubicado en edificio anexo y orientado a celebrar eventos.

Ubicado en la tranquilidad de un t√≠pico huerto ilicitano, delante de un enorme parque de palmeras, a escasos diez minutos a pie del centro de la ciudad, Jard√≠n Milenio ofrece a precio bastante econ√≥mico unas instalaciones m√°s que dignas: habitaciones muy amplias, piscina, jardines, un desayuno bastante completo, una amplia carta de masajes, ... En definitiva, unas condiciones inmejorables para disfrutar de esta bella y animada ciudad.

Hotel ubicado a cinco - diez minutos del centro, en una zona tranquila, rodeado de jardines con palmeras. Decoraci√≥n con aire r√∫stico. Limpio y bien cuidado.

Habitaciones amplias y confortables, con camas de 2 mts x 2 mts, un ba√±o grande con una ducha fenomenal, que cuenta con un chorro de agua muy potente.
El kit de aseo incluye un dosificador de gel/ champ√∫, que no es de muy buena calidad y cuesta un poco que salga el gel, en nuestro caso, el del lavabo no funcionaba.

Cuenta con un parking privado (6,50 ‚Ç¨ el d√≠a), que es mejor usar, si no cuentas con suerte de aparcar en los pocos sitios disponibles que hay cerca al hotel.

En definitiva es un hotel agradable y funcional, sin mayores lujos, que no te decepcionar√°.

S√∫per recomendable el restaurante del hotel. Comida de buena calidad!

Unas habitaciones super amplias y muy comodas, la cama esta compuesta por dos camas de matrimonio, los alrededores del hotel cuentan con unos jardines encantadores.
S√≥lo una peque√±a molestia al escucharse ruidos de otros hu√©spedes.
Muy recomendable

Estuvimos el verano pasado y fue una pasada. Realmente bonito, sus jardines llenos de verde y palmeras... Nos lo pasamos estupendo! Piscina grande, dormitorios limpios y amplios. El trato muy correcto, la chica de recepcion te explica la localizacion de todos los lugares de interes a tu llegada. Tambien estuvimos en su restaurante, comimos genial en la terraza, disfrutando rodeados de palmeras. Sin lugar a duda, la respuesta acertada si viajas a Elche.

La decoraci√≥n es un poco rara pero el hotel esta limpio y bien cuidado.
Tiene una piscina peque√±a pero suficiente para refrescarte despu√©s de un d√≠a de trabajo si te hospedas por negocios.
Esta un poco alejado del resto de edificios rodeado de palmeras por lo que apenas se escuchan ruidos desagradables.

titulo: Buena opci√≥n pero con un toque raro
conteudo:
Alguna cr√≠tica ya lo indica antes.
Se trata de un hotel muy bueno, con habitaciones muy amplias (a destacar si viajas con ni√±os, inclu√≠do el ba√±o que es enorme). El desayuno es variado y correcto, sin lujos pero aceptable.
Las instalaciones son c√≥modas y amplias y su localizaci√≥n aunque parece que apartado, est√° a apenas 5-min andando del centro de Elche.
Pero, es cierto que el hotel tiene un extra√±o toque rancio que por las instalaciones y las caracter√≠sticas del hotel ser√≠a f√°cilmente moldeable y permitir√≠a brillar con mayor luz las instalaciones del hotel que tienen mucho potencial.
El descanso fue de buena calidad sin ruidos ni molestias y a destacar en mi caso (esto ya sabemos que es personal) una c√≥moda almohada.
No me gust√≥, como casi en ning√∫n hotel que opta por esta opci√≥n, los dosificadores de jab√≥n-champ√∫ a granel en el lavabo y en la ducha,
El kit de aseo era completo con kit de limpieza de dientes y afeitado.
El precio est√° acorde con lo ofrecido.

Excelente hotel ubicado en el palmeral de elche uno de los sitios que deves visitar si vas a elche ya que es patrimonio de la humanidad el hotel dispone de parking propio vigilado el precio es de 6,50 por dia habitaciones amplias y modernas eso si las tv son un poco peque√±as es la unica pega que le pondria excelente desayuno y muy buena relacion calidad-precio

Podr√≠a.... Pero, aunque la situaci√≥n, en medio del palmeral,las habitaciones grandes, los servicios comunes correctos, incluyendo la piscina, tiene algo, no se sabe muy bien porque, envejecido o rancio, que no le deja brillar como deber√≠a.
Consejo: no coja habitaci√≥n pr√≥xima a recepci√≥n, ya que le parecer√° durante toda su estancia que no est√° s√≥lo en su habitaci√≥n...supongo que la sonoridad se puede solucionar as√≠ como el goteo constante del ba√±o.

This hotel is really good great location , excellent staff friendly and know there jobs the guests are really taken care of . It‚Äôs mainly Spanish and so are the staff but they made every effort to explain anything we wanted to know , like the lunch or dinner menu.
It‚Äôs extremely clean and the pool is very well situated surrounded by palm trees , if you want read a book or just take a peaceful relax by the pool it‚Äôs great .
We had to cut our stay short by a couple of days and they were extremely helpful .
We will return

Spent a week here, weather was great the whole time. We were only room only, but paid the extra 7 euros each for breakfast, which was good value. Freshly squeezed orange juice, bacon, scrambled eggs, fried eggs, hot chocolate, churros, cooked meats, cheese and pastries. One day we went for breakfast before 9am, and there were hardly any pastries left, when l asked if there were any more, l was told there wasn't, which wasn't very good considering breakfast ran until 1030am. Apart from that, enjoyable, quality breakfast.

Room was large with good air conditioning. Pillows comfortable as was the bed, but a bit squeaky! Nice pool area away from hotel, we had lunch there one day which was good value and really nice. There was a wedding reception there on the Saturday which was nice to watch. It seems more of a business hotel, but we were more than happy with our stay.

The hotel is located across from a park where locals walk. Hotel also has well maintained grounds and a pool which unfortunately closes too early. Breakfast is
Not so extensive but excellent quality. However some front desk staff can be really
Short and unapproachable.

Nice hotel, with a wonderful garden, plenty of palm trees all over, in the garden, in the city, really adorable place, nice swimming pool, good breakfast. Little bit old furniture, but very good hotel for the price.

titulo: Perfect base for exploring the area
conteudo:
We booked our stay at The Jardin Milenio after spending hours looking for accommodation that looked appealing and was within our budget and it didn‚Äôt disappoint. The staff were pleasant and helpful and, as we‚Äôd hoped, the pool was never too busy. Surrounded by palm trees and itself an attractive building we found the perfect combination of being away from the crowds but close enough to the coast (20min drive) which we could explore without travelling for any length of time. We enjoyed a buffet breakfast each morning which provided a choice of pastries, cold meats, cooked bacon and eggs, yogurts, fruit, cereal and all the drinks you would expect with staff topping up as needed. The mini bar fridge provided enough extra space to store a small amount of your own chilled food/drink and the room was clean and spacious. We were also able to park with ease in the car park at the rear of the hotel, most of which was covered parking to keep the sun off. There was an additional ‚Ç¨6 fee per day but compared to uk hotels, this didn‚Äôt seem unreasonable.
I would thoroughly recommend a stay at this hotel!

The hotel is very good, the pool is excellent, the location is very good near the city center, the restaurant is spectacular !!, the agents of the Front desk are very friendly and help with what is needed,The only bad thing about this hotel is that the air conditioning in the rooms does not cool at all, and the beds are extremely hard, not at all comfortable

titulo: Confortable, clean is a good option
conteudo:
This hotel located near to downtown (Walking distance) beside of ‚ÄúLos Palmerales‚Äù. Not far from the hospital.

Have a pool, a roof to enjoy a quiet moment, big rooms and confortable.

Is a nice option for families.

Fantastic friendly hotel ideally situated for a 2 day break in Elche .
Competitively priced ,clean bright rooms and pleasant staff .
Well done to all staff members who made our stay so enjoyable and nothing was a bother .

Perfectly located for visiting any of Elches‚Äôs attractions. Comfortable rooms, lots of cheap parking and a very nice breakfast. If in town again I won‚Äôt have any hesitation in station here. Unfortunately it was still a little chilly to use the swimming pool but some brave souls had!

We stayed here for a weekend break. Excellent attentive staff on reception, both very helpful. Hotel is very comfortable and the atmosphere is excellent. Rooms are very comfortable also and the beds and pillow are wonderful. Mini bar prices are excellent! The breakfast is very good and the dining area spacious and bright. Parking is an extra cost but not overly expensive. 15 minute walk to the main centre and the walk there is attractive. Views from the hotel overlook the palm trees and all in all i would highly recommend this hotel for your stay in Elche.

Location was great being only 15 mins walk to city centre set amongst palm gardens and best of all large bedrooms/bathroom tastefully decorated.
Breakfast again was a very good standard with good choice but the hot dishes could have been hotter made up though by freshly squeezed orang juice, delicious!
The only problem encountered was the noise from a private party in the garden restaurant which went on to the early hours and only stopped when I complained to reception.so check with reception and request a room furthest away.

Was staying at this hotel due to my husband being hospitalised. Being solo I felt very secure and at ease. Rooms good size with everything you need. Breakfast was excellent. Plenty of on-site parking which for me was great and very reasonably priced. Easy check-in and staff very very helpful at all times. Did not have dinner but one evening did have very yummy pizza from Bar/cafeteria where breakfast was served. No complaints from bar staff even though a little late - great service. Restaurant looked lovely but did not use. I would go back !

We had a short break in Elche and was very impressed with this hotel. Its located just 5-10 mins walk from the town centre which has great offers for food and drink. The hotel itself offers free parking a lovely pool and great staff, rooms are spacious and very spanish in the decor. Breakfast at ‚Ç¨9pp is good value. I would certainly stay again.

We stayed here for one night while on holiday in Torrevieja. We booked because it was convenient for a vineyard tour we'd planned. The hotel was just what we needed. Clean spacious rooms, convenient bar and restaurant and relaxing pool area. The staff were extremely helpful especially the young lady on reception who arranged a lift for us so we could go on our trip when the taxis were on strike. The breakfast was continental but plenty to choose from. The public spaces were very comfortable with plenty of places to sit and relax. There was also a gym and sauna. Next time I hope to stay longer.

titulo: A FINE HOTEL, BUT A BIT TOO CORPORATE FOR MY TASTE
conteudo:
When on vacation, the town of Elx is a fantastic place to spend some time between a week-end and a week. I drove a rental to the hotel without breaking a sweat since it lies just off the town maze. After parking the car, it took me a 10-minute stroll to reach the central barrios. Meaning to say that the location is great. Besides, right across the street there is one of those millennium palm growths, for which Elx is justly famous. My room was very spacious, thanks also to sparse furnishings. Good bed, an assortment of pillows, excellent A/C system. Tile floor. The colour scheme was mustard-ochre-dark green, which was a bit gloomy to my taste.
What in my view the room lacked was atmosphere, or character. It felt like one in your typical upper-mid-class chain hotel. It felt corporate. If that‚Äôs your preference, you‚Äôll feel right at home. I was particularly appalled by a voluminous wardrobe that dominated the room offering perfect functionality paired with the aesthetics of a cement block painted olive green. A smallish flat-screen TV. In an otherwise grandly appointed bathroom, the plainest shower head and a leaky water screen.
And a single room has cost me 100 EUR. For a provincial town in Spain, I find it a slight exaggeration. I stayed one night, so it didn‚Äôt make a big difference, but for a longer stay I‚Äôd probably prefer somewhere more atmospheric and more economic.
To end on a sweet note, the hotel has on its premises a marvellous restaurant, La Taula, that offers classy but inexpensive gourmet cuisine in an elegant atmosphere. I‚Äôll write a separate review about it to avoid mixing dates with oranges.

titulo: Average hotel, nice but nothing special, noisy
conteudo:
We stayed a night in Jardin Milenio to be close to an attraction we'd planned to see. Initially, we were assigned a room just off the reception area and found it noisy, so we moved rooms. Our new room was on the 2nd floor and was indeed better. However, it was still noisy. People came into the hotel late at night, were loud in the corridors and we could still hear people conversing and television even after they must have been in their rooms.
Check in was not difficult, but the receptionist didn't speak great English and it was not the easiest either.
The hotel charges for parking. They also require one to leave a 10 euro deposit in cash for each pool towel you wish to check out. I found that quite distasteful for a hotel that was purported to be an upper end hotel.
The room was clean and comfortable, but the noise made for a difficult night. Breakfast was included, but since we were leaving early, we could only get a take out picnic. It was OK and ready on time. We needed to pay for parking in the morning as we checked out, but the clerk was checking out another guest, so it was a considerable wait. Finally, I just put cash on the counter, didn't wait for change and left so we could arrive for our tour on time. Not a great experience.

Had to stay in elche while my father was in hospital, so was thrilled to find this oasis of calm. A very clean efficient hotel, with a wonderful swimming pool. Friendly staff and comfortable rooms, only downside rooms were noisy, would suggest requesting a first floor room.

titulo: Well located and an easy walk into the Old Town
conteudo:
This is a good location near the palm tree gardens. It's a 10 minute walk into the old town with plenty to see there. The hotel staff are all very friendly the restaurant is good for meals with well priced fresh food.

Car parking is barrier controlled with a corrugated iron roof over all the plentiful car parking spaces.

Nice pool area with additional seating for cocktails

titulo: Best option for a late arrival on Alicante airport or a stay in Elche
conteudo:
Taking into consideration our late arrival at Alicante/Elche airport, we've decided to book for our first night in Costa Blanca a hotel in the proximity that would offer also the feeling of summer vacation! Jardin Milenio in Elche prooved to be the best option. The hotel is located near the town center, but in a green garden. It offers a good accommodation and tasty breakfast. It has a pool also, but we hadn't time to enjoy it.
The hotel has a private payble parking, but you can also park outside the hotel's grounds, for free.

We had a 4 day break at the Jardin Milenio.

Checkin and Reception were very pleasant and efficient. We were SC so didn't sample the restaurant.

Our room was very clean and the bathroom adequate. The pool area is very pleasant with lots of sun beds. There are 2 reception rooms by the pool used for weddings and parties which looked very promising if required ?

We have stayed in Elche many times before but not at the Jardin Milenio.

We found the location is perfect for walking into the main square or across the bridge into residential Elche.

We recommend and will probably stay again.

titulo: Peaceful hotel for a relaxing weekend
conteudo: A good 10 minutes walk into town but a lovely quiet hotel. The bedrooms and bathrooms are a very good size. Huge bed. Very comfortable stay. Not the weather to use the pool but looks lovely for summer. Parking onsite or on the nearby roads.

Spent three nights here last summer and can't wait to return! The location is wonderful and very quiet, even though it only took us about 10 minutes to get to Elche center on foot. Clean and elegant hotel, pool was just right. The hotel restaurant was fantastic, and so was the service. Can't wait to go back!

The hotel is well located with an easy walk into the centre of the city. The rooms are large and well appointed. The swimming pool is excellent but they could do with a few more loungers. The staff were helpful although they had a bit of a problem with UK driving licenses as ID.

Just returned from a 5 night stay with my daughter, we had a lovely time.
Arrived well before check in time and our room was ready, I had emailed and requested a room overlooking the pool, this was granted, lovely spacious room, very clean...
We had lunch by the pool everyday which was lovely, it felt very high end
Special thanks to Andres who served us most days, excellent customer service.
Only one downside the breakfast was a bit hit and miss, especially the hot food.
Also excellent service from Miguel.
Would not hesitate to recommend or return.
All staff lovely.

This 4 star hotel has everything you need for a pleasant stay: elegant, super tidy and very spacious rooms with a generous bathroom, fridge with bar/beverages and some snacks, big pool with enough sun beds around and another small one for kids, pool bar, restaurant if you don't feel like going out for dinner or lunch, roofed private parking, 24h reception and helpful staff. Also a little play ground for children.

The beddings were very nice and comfy, the AC worked quietly and the neighborhood is calm, so we had a very restful night.

The breakfast was delicious, big choices on bread, fruits, yoghurt, juices etc. and very good value.

We would definitely recommend this hotel and plan already to return there next time!

I arrived at the hotel to be greeted by a cool reception area and a warm welcome.
My room proved to be spacious and airy and an excellent place to relax.
I can't however be as fulsome with my praise of their restaurant. Perhaps it was because, as a new arrival in Spain, I hadn't got my body clock in sync with Spanish custom of eating late, but, having hung out as long as I could, I found my 8.00pm dinner sitting both lonely and disappointing. Apart from that, it was a very enjoyable stay and I almost decided to stay a few days longer...

We had a Pleasant comfortable stay .The room was clean with great air conditioning which is a god send in the July heat.The pool and surroundings are very beautiful .The only thing I didn't agree with was having to pay an extra 6euros per day to park in the hotel car park .You don't have anywhere else to park either so you don't have much choice.

titulo: Great hotel great value for the money
conteudo: A wonderful hotel in a nice quiet part of town surrounded by palm forests, the rooms are spacious and clean very attentive staff with beautiful gardens and a lovely swimming pool, short walking distance to the old town

titulo: Lovely hotel but avoid the bar/restaurant
conteudo:
We loved this hotel and Elche, It is easy to get to Elche from Alicante city or airport, we got the train from the city, and taxi transportation within Elche is cheap and easy.

The grounds of the hotel and the pool area are very attractive and the hotel is only 10 minutes walk from the city centre and most of the park and gardens. The hotel itself is very smart with great design ideas and the reception staff are very polite and very efficient. The room was very good, clean and big with free wifi.

The only problem was the bar/restaurant inside the hotel. The service was poor - just too few staff and slow with it, and the food was a huge disappointment. It was not so much bad cooking but strange ideas of foods that go together and no flavour. The are however fantastic restaurants nearby in the city. There is another very well regarded hotel restaurant within its grounds but we did not go in there after the first night's disappointment. But at least the drinks were not expensive in the hotel bar or the room's minibar.

Elche is a fantastic city to stay and we cannot wait to return. There are lots of beautiful parks and there are palms everywhere. The river bed, castle and basilica are all well worth a view as are the numerous back street tapas bars. There are also lots of quality shopping streets as well as a commercial shopping centre.

Booked this based on price as a last minute weekend getaway. Hotel is clean and attractive inside. Staff are nice. Room was spacious, clean and with a nice bathroom. View was good...really no complaints. The breakfast was nice but by the time we got to it (after 10am) there wasn't so much choice and at 7 euros there is better value in town....which is a short walk away. Very nice hotel probably will return.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for three nights on our first visit to Elche. We were greeted by two friendly and polite reception staff at check in. This hotel is situated in the Palm groves and has beautiful grounds. Our room on the first floor was large and clean with a good sized bathroom. Hair drier could have done with being updated as it was one of the ones attached to wall with a fairly rigid hose and not very hot air. Air conditioning in the rooms was very quite. There are seating areas both in the hotel and in the gardens and it also has a swimming pool. We booked on a bed and breakfast basis and the breakfast was nice with lots to choose from e.g. Cereals, pastries, breads, fresh fruits, cold meats, cheeses, yogurts, eggs etc. Hotel also has a restaurant in the grounds which I have reviewed separately as it's also open to the public. Don't go- way over rated and priced. Did not try the room service and if you want to go out to eat at night it is a bit of a walk (15/20 mins). Hotel also has a car park but charge 6.50 Euro/day to use which I think should be free for residents. Enjoyed our stay and would stay again if ever back in Elche.

I have gait challenges (stroke); accom. has to be convenient to shopping and/or sights.
Being very central, it is also very tranquil; a beautiful property. Well-appointed rooms and facilities. Close to sights, historic old town, tapas, beers, shops, restaurants. Parking was great. Would recommend.

Just a short walk from the centre of town, this is a charming and attractive hotel. I was impressed with the number of cosy and romantic seating areas located in the hotel, including a large balcony with comfortable chairs, ideal for a sundowner! Our room was large, nicely decorated with a very comfortable bed. There was also a small settee and two chairs and a small desk. The bathroom was a good size with a bath/shower and attractively tiled. Although it was too cold to use the pool, that too looked very attractive and inviting. The gardens and the outside seating areas were also well maintained and attractive.

We also enjoyed an excellent dinner in the hotel restaurant, which is located in the gardens adjacent to the hotel. The food was really delicious, beautifully presented and the service discrete and professional, The hotel receptionist was also very friendly and helpful

titulo: Clean and lovely affordable hotel located in the center of town
conteudo:
The hotel was well situated and offered clean and comfortable accommodations.
The staff was friendly and very accommodating. We requested a room change to the quieter side of the building only because the one we had faced the main street. Without hesitation we were given another room. The rooms are spacious, with large closet space, a mini fridge and a large bed. The bathroom was huge. We were lucky that during the time of our visit the hotel was offering a breakfast special for a buffet breakfast at 7 EUR per person. The food was fresh, with a good variety. I highly recommend this place and will stay there again when I return.

I picked this hotel as it was not too far from the airport and seemed quiet.
The hotel is beautifully situated in the palm groves but a short 10 minute walk to the city. The hotel has a lovely outdoor pool in the garden & sauna on the roof , I also saw a small gym but it was too hot for strenuous exercise.
The room was a good size, comfortable bed & very clean. The shower was an over bath small head so wasn't expecting much but wow it was really powerful. There was also a radio in the bathroom which was a great touch.
Air conditioning was very good & so quiet, didn't even realise it was on until you stepped out the room & felt the heat.
WiFi is free & quite fast, there was a TV in the room but never got round to switching it on.
Breakfast was very good - great selection of food presented in a very clean setting, it was incredible that with the heat there were no flies. Coffee came out of a machine it was good but mysterious as came out hot but within few minutes was cold, never managed to keep coffee warm enough to drink & enjoy.
Meal's were a challenge, lunch in the bar was limited but enjoyed the Caesar Salad & Spanish omelette however at the end of the week I was given a different menu that didn't have an English translation so had to rely on picking out odd words to work out what was on offer & the assistance of the waiter, he seemed a bit surprised when I asked for the English translated menu as if it didn't exist that was a weird moment, but I had a delicious asparagus dish that certainly wasn't on the other menu - all very twilight zone.
I have to mention the dogs as really there is no escaping their noise, I was told by reception that there are 4 dogs belonging to their neighbour. What astounds me that the noise nuisance caused by the dogs has been allowed to go on & why has no one taken direct action! The dogs do not just bark they whine particularly when police car goes by with sirens blaring. Still having read trip advisor I was prepared & as the windows were closed because of aircon they didn't really bother me but they do go on throughout the night.
Great hotel, lovely staff highly recommend.

We found the experience different from our normal holiday venue primarily because of the distance from any part of the coast and Elche being more of a large town environment. If you are in need of a pharmacy , dentist or doctors , these were in more abundance than any good Restuarant or general shopping area. Although the centre of Elche had a few museums, a cathedral and palm tree plantation this was not enough to capture our interest for 9 days !! . This was the first time we have not hired a car whilst on holiday in Spain but felt the bus service from Elche to other areas i.e Alicante, Murcia were very inexpensive and very good service. Not only were the Restuarant staff unfriendly but could not offer a good level of food and very few spoke English. After visiting the sister hotel Huerto Del Cura ( approx 10 mins away from Jardin ) we found this to be a much more pleasant alternative in a better setting and closer to the centre. Also found their restaurant to be the finest eateries in Elche and would recommend this . BEWARE : The tourist information board in Elche were very efficient and handed us a 10% discount brochure against 4 hotels one of which being the Jardin Milenio on presentation to hotel against our final bill. It was firstly accepted that they agreed to the discount , only to be told 48 hours later that they would not honour the discount as we had booked with booking.com. This we disputed as it was not showing on the brochure and after protracted conversations with the hotel they gave us 5% token discount on 3 of the 9 nights. This left a very bad taste !

Older, wiser? Getting to know and like these hidden gems / boutique hotels.

You won't go wrong with this one - a lovely lovely hotel set in fabulous lawns and gardens on the outskirts ( 5 min walk ) from central Elche.

Nice clean rooms with free Air Con and great free fast WiFi.

Breakfast clean fresh, hot where necessary, cold where not.

Put this hotel on your list if you're undecided and flying / sailing into Alicante or Murcia region.

Great rooms, pool quiet and equipped, off the beaten track but a small walk to restaurants and bars if wanted, also not far to the beach on the bus, great service, very accommodating although need to ask, would recommend for a very Spanish break.

Lovely rooms, friendly staff and beautiful views of endless palm trees where ever you look. The restaurant was really special but as we had booked a half board deal which was amazing value the food was very disappointing , however if you have the a la carte menu it had a better variety of choices.
The pool area was fantastic and again stunning views.

Invited here for a weeding we spent three days in this structure. The Hotel is placed not far from the centre of Elche (5/10 minutes walking) in a beautiful park. The hotel is renovated with a beautiful pool inside the green park. Rooms are clean, huge with AC and all what is needed for a comfort stay. Staff is nice and the breakfast is really good with a wide choice. Price in line with the quality of the service offered. Well done!

My friend booked this for us as a 4 day getaway in the sun. I had no other expectations than sunbathing, cocktails and tapas to be honest! It cost about 25 euros by taxi to get there...we discovered there is a bus you can get that takes to the airport from the town but we waited an hour and every bus that came said it was the next one..maybe we were unlucky but I'd say get the cab. It's inland and very pretty, right by the palm Grove. I recommend using your first day to wander about and get your bearings. We headed right out of the hotel and 10-15mins walk gets you to the town. There's a few cheap as chips supermarkets (we carried big bottles of water back to our room to have by the pool) and a selection of restaurants and cafes. Reception were so amazing at helping us with bus routes, restaurant recommendations, Natalie in particular was great. Also a lady who was doing an internship - again so helpful and smiley and friendly. There's a masseuse Maria who can come in, she does AMAZING massages for a great price. The rooms were cleaned to a great standard every day, the food at the restaurant is delicious and the cocktails were so good! The pool was a decent size and the perfect place to cool down after a few hours in the sun. Everything is just quiet, well looked after and I guess because it is less touristy you do get to properly switch off. We did. Be prepared to brush up on a few words of Spanish as we found a fair few places struggled with English and some didn't have English menus. They try to help when they can...the hotel was great for this ... our waiters were always pleasant and respectful. There's nothing I could fault about this hotel and our holiday at all. Go! You won't be disappointed!

I booked the hotel after seeing the photos. It is in fact a beautiful location not far from the 'Huerto del Cura'. The staff were quite helpful although we did have a problem with my booking.....or rather they said there was a problem, but after messing around on their computer for about 20 minutes they realized that my booking was ok!!
The room was spacious with two enormous beds. The pool area looked very relaxing but the weather was not so good so we didn't use it. Breakfast a good variety of sweet and savoury food.

titulo: Poor cleaning and poor maintenance of the room
conteudo: I booked this hotel for its position - close to The Palm Grove (El Palmeral), and for its great reviews, but I was a bit disappointed. Everyone talks about its beautiful garden, big rooms and very rich breakfast. These all are true, but another true is that the rooms (or at least the one I received) are not well preserved and the cleaning is really poor. You can see the attached pictures.

A blocked drain in the bathroom which looked to be a regular occurence was sorted within an hour. Dogs barking at 2am and 5am for over an hour at a time, when I had asked for a quiet room. These problems stopped me awarding an excellent review.

hotel very pretty surroundings and tidy. very near airport about 30 minutes away and taxi was around 25 euro. i was only there one night and had to be up early so they made me a pack up breakfast and wake up call, lady called esther (i think) on reception was lovely and very helpful, she kindly opened up/turned on the sauna for me which had a nice view of palm trees and i watched the sunset

titulo: The hotel is in the middle of palm trees
conteudo: Nice hotel in a beautiful location amongst palm garden. Close to the historical city center where a lot of attractions and restaurants. Good breakfast and dinner. Clean room cleaning. Beautiful garden

This is a lovely and comfortable hotel. It has a retro feel but not at the cost of any comfort (wi-fi, well equipped bathroom, ....) Breakfast though offering a limited number of choices was tasty and met our expectations. The staff was pleasant and helpful.
The rooms were rather large and well furnished. The hotel was easy to reach and offers a nice parking lot in the back.

This is an unusual but delightful hotel set in amongst palm trees with a lovely outdoor pool. it is quiet and comfortable and clean the staff are helpful.
The restaurant is excellent and I had a wonderful tapas full of delicious flavours. A most enjoyable stay.

the hotel is very clean the room was spacious however there wasn't any tea/coffee making facilities in the room. We could have ordered it through room service but there is only 1 member of staff working on the bar, dining room and room service so the wait would have been hours.
The breakfast is 10‚Ç¨ extra we tried it once it wasn't worth the 10‚Ç¨ so we didn't bother again.
Car parking is 6.50‚Ç¨ daily.
The downside of this hotel is the constant barking of neighbours dogs day and night.
The hotel felt like an English Travel Lodge rather a than a 4* Hotel.
The town of Elche is beautiful with lovely restaurants and it was very Spanish which we liked.

A very nice hotel, lovely big room overlooking the patio , very clean towels and bed linen changed daily, the staff were very friendly and helpful too, we stayed for a week as we had a wedding to go to in Elche, lovely pool area to relax and have a drink and a bite to eat too, not far to walk to the centre. not far from Alicante either. we would highly recommend this hotel.

We stayed here for an early flight home. The hotel is very clean and the staff most helpful. The room was very large with a sofa. The bathroom is also large. The whole hotel is nicely decorated. If you just want a snack the bar is very cheap - pizza 7 euros and salad 8 euros. The downside is parking is 6.5 euros.

We had a Spacious room overlooking the Patio. The room had a very well thought out large bathroom. We had booked half board and had our dinner in the bar, had we wanted to eat in the very attractive restaurant near to the swimming pool, we would have had to pay a supplement. The dinner was good and the breakfast was excellent.
All of the staff were very, very helpful and we would have no hesitation in recommending the hotel. The only downside was the noise from the barking dogs in a nearby private house. Fortunately the double glazing was good, so when the windows were shut the noise was reduced. The wifi was fine for downloading emails, but slow for anything else.
origem: San Juan de los Terreros, Spain

conteudo: Really enjoyed our stay here. Hotel was clean and relaxing. The pool is great with a nice spacious area for chilling out and having a refreshing drink. Elche town is walking distance away and a beautiful place to visit with plenty of shopping to be had.

Clean and cozy hotel. Around lot of palms,nice view.good service ,rooms are big enought. Restaurant la taula very good and high quality food.swimming pool...................................................................

Stopped here for the night whilst heading to the south of Spain. easy to find of the AP7 and located in the palmeras gardens area. Free parking and a nice welcome form reception staff and pleased with the large spacious room and free wifi. The restaurant was closed for the season and the meals in the bistro were not being served until 22.30 hours. we were tired from travelling so settled for a room service sandwich. nice gardens and pool area for the hotter seasons. Would return again if back in the area as good value for money.

Comfortable room. Nice grounds to walk about. Friendly service. Free parking. Swimming pool but too cold in January.
Convenient restaurant. Well what else can I say to make the 200 character minimum. We liked the place. If we come back to Elche, we will go again. Let me say that again, if we come back to Elche, we will enjoy staying at this hotel again. Quiet room.

Stayed here for 3 nights, where here for business so didn't spend that much time on the hotel but liked what i did see. The rooms was good size and clean, the breakfast was good and the restaurant next door was very nice to, Walking distance to the central part of the town so all in all had everything that we needed.

Booked the hotel from one of the many websites you can book from today and did not incl. breakfast, was glad i didn¬¥t since it was more or less 5‚Ç¨ cheaper to buy when we arrived at the hotel.

Excellent hotel set in beautiful gardens & great pool area - lovely airy feel as soon as you walk in - tastefully decorated - friendly staff - good breakfast selection, though hot food limited to scrambled egg bacon & cocktail type sausage. A very enjoyable visit

titulo: Best relaxing stay in a long time!!!
conteudo:
We stayed here for one night and wish we could have stayed for another couple of nights!

The setting in a palm grove s relaxing, the beds were comfy (singles pushed together), the size was great, wifi was fast, AC was quiet and efficient, bathroom was great! Went for a swim in the pool, which was fun. dinner at the hotel restaurant was wonderful, but don't have any tapas before you go because the portions are huge. Parking is covered and fenced and very reasonably priced. There is a mini-bar fridge that is big enough to put some of your own stuff into, like drinks and leftovers from the restaurant.

The breakfast is reduced if you buy it at check-in, and is very nice (and a good deal)!

There seems to be a nice set of rooms that would be adequate for a small conference, if you need to organize one! You can walk to the city center without much difficulty.

If I have a chance to return to Elche/Elx, I would definitely stay at the Jardin Milenio again! Since I normally like variety and trying different places, this is a high complement!!

Stayed here for a very relaxing week. Staff were very friendly and offered a good level of service.the bar and dining area were soulless and purely functional and didn't encourage lingering. The separate restaurant by the pool offered far better food and atmosphere. The pool area is very good with a choice of loungers or table and chairs for relaxing. Would definitely stay again.

titulo: Second rate guest at full price
conteudo:
We arrived late saturday night and were checked in rather quickly, got directed to our room which was clean and neat, albeit a bit dated. We were awoken rather early by the scuffling of large furniture down the hall and the feeling of our rock hard and lumpy beds.

Apparently it was in the middle of some spanish family holiday, where the younglings are celebrated, like a confirmation of sorts. This ment the hotel was filled to the brim with non-staying guests and almost all ammenities and services were closed.
The restaurant was off limits, the bar was dedicated to the party guests and the pool, gym, sunroof and everything alike was closed off.
We were instead appointed to a small seat in a less than sunny courtyard, right next to the playground where the kids of the party guests were understandably playing around.

I understand that hotels have parties and banquets, but we were not offered a discount or any form of notice. But instead asked to pay full price for access to close to no ammenities. So much for a relaxing holiday.

elche is a wonderfull greeen historical city and this hotel is the perfect stay receppie in the midle of beautiful garden
rooms are big and clean
the place is silent and the food decent.
i am visiting this place twice per year because I have business in the area and I do recomend

We stayed three nights there recently on vacation. This is off season but the weather was great and this hotel is in a perfect location if you like to walk around the sights of Elche. It is a little cheaper than the better known Huerto del Cura, but it is owned and operated by the same people. It hit the high points for my needs in a hotel: clean, comfortable bed and good shower. If fact, this was one of the better showers I've ever experienced. Pressure was so great you actually had to turn the water down. Beds are very firm, as they are throughout Europe, but it was comfortable. The room was very clean and the service staff was very friendly.

This hotel is a little difficult to find if you don't know your way around, but it is located in a protected area of the Palm Tree forest. It is an easy walk into town and all the sights. The small train that takes tourists throughout the city has a stop just steps away from the front door.

There is adequate parking and some of it is covered. And the breakfast is excellent. Includes cooked eggs, sausage, fruits, cheeses, and excellent pastries and fruit juices. We enjoyed it very much. We didn't try the hotel restaurant, but it is in a beautiful setting and looked very nice.

Hotel also has excellent free Wi-Fi.

We arrived after a very long car journey and were very greatful for the comfy beds and good shower. Enjoyed a late afternoon swim in the pool, wasn't too busy and transats were reasonably clean.
The rooms were large, air conditioned with a mini fridge (very useful), the only drawback was that the bin collection was around 5.30am, noisy and just underneath our window!
Breakfast buffet was good, it had a very large choice.

titulo: Excellent hotel- but bring a phrasebook
conteudo:
This hotel is extremely clean, quiet and efficient. The rooms were cleaned daily but the maids never disturbed us and were very friendly which was lovely.
Breakfast had a range of foods, some traditional Spanish breakfasts, pastries, yoghurt, fruit, cereals..cooked stuff was just boiled egg, scrambled egg and bacon which had been sat out and wasn't great, but all the other food was lovely anyway.
The pool was really quiet and clean, the pool food was lovely and service excellent; just had to call from the phone by the bar and they came straight away!
The La Taula restaurant was absolutely delicious- the set tapas menu was very reasonably priced and had a huge range of really interesting food.
The hotel is a very short walk from the town centre where there is a range of shops, bars and restaurants- but bring a phrasebook or do some translating beforehand as almost no one speaks english!
Recommended: Lazarran Restaurant and Datil de Oro restaurant
Overall a very quiet and relaxing holiday, not tourist-y in the slightest but still friendly and interesting!

titulo: Relaxed, clean, friendly and close to the town
conteudo:
This was a last minute trip, and we really fell on our feet here. hotel is clean, quiet and we couldn't fault the staff. Pool was quiet for our stay, sometimes we were the only ones there. Pool food was superb, and service excellent, once you let the staff know you wanted something.

Just a few minutes walk from the town centre which has many different bars and restaurants to choose from. A vibrant square with lots going on at night. Definitely worth adopting the Spanish way of eating around 10pm to become immersed in the atmosphere.

titulo: Lovely quiet hotel...but don't expect anyone to rush!
conteudo:
Stayed at this hotel for a week and had a really lovely holiday. It is a very quiet and peaceful hotel and the vibe is very chilled and laid back. I think it would make a great hotel for couples - bit too quiet for kids I think.

The room was large and clean and the air con (much needed) was efficient. There was a small mini bar and the bathroom was spacious and clean. The all-important shower was hot and strong.

The real highlight of the hotel is the pool. Shaded by palms and with nice warm water, there are a few tables by the pool where you can eat lunch.

The hotel is a short walk from the town centre where there are lots of bars and restaurants (to be honest not all that great a choice of food) and again, a very friendly safe vibe.

Please don't expect to speak English at this hotel (or in the town) as only the recptionist spoke English. The waiters spoke not one word so arm yourself witha few phrases!

Downsides? The service is VERY slow. Long wait for a waiter by the pool. Long wait to even get a menu in the restaurant! So patience is a virtue

Also, the loungers by the pool are TERRIBLE! really uncomfortable and a lot of them broken. Time to get some new ones!

titulo: A nice quiet calm peaceful hotel
conteudo: First city break for a while and we were surprised with how good Elche is to visit - and cheap as well. The hotel - Jardin Milenio - is well staffed and friendly and most importantly, clean. It has large rooms and is situated in a nice spot with an easy stroll into town. Good food & great value.

titulo: If you want to relax ... Go to this hotel
conteudo:
My daughter and I travelled to Elche to visit friends. I am pleased to report that this hotel is consistently excellent. We did book last minute and got a really good deal. The hotel is very clean, good air con and very friendly helpful staff. I agree with jksiv the pool is the star of the show, never too busy, always clean and a handy G&T to make the experience complete for me! Breakfast is very generous and the lunch served by the pool is lovely, very casual but with nice table cloths and formal waiter service. Elche is renowned for it's 1000's of palm trees, it's a very Spanish city, which for us is the attraction (no 'tea like mum makes' here thank goodness!). The seaside resort of Santa Pola is only 20mins by car or bus if you want the beach. I would recommend you visit the Plaza Santa Maria, beautiful architecture and lovely selection of Tapas bars etc. plus the world flagship Zara is just around the corner! It's in an old theatre and they have kept some of the features, they are open until 9pm so worth a visit.
Worth a try is Lizarro which is on the corner opposite the Basilica , in the evening they serve 'pinchos' small pieces of bread with cold (get from inside) and hot (they will come and offer them to you) toppings...very nice! You pay by keeping the small sticks and declaring them when you pay your bill. Or hop in a taxi and go to Sansano's the best tapas in our opinion and they have a couple of menus with English translations. I would say this is not a hotel for families with very small children, or if you like a lot going on. For us it's perfect and we would recommend.

First holiday without kids in 22 years and thought we would try an inland hotel. Generally we couldn't fault the hotel, helpful reception, clean rooms, air conditioning
which worked well, en suite bathroom, hair dryer supplied, mini bar if you wanted it.
The rooms were cleaned every day. The hotel is about a 10 minute slow walk in August from the city centre, the area swamped by hundreds of palm trees, so many, that after a few days you don't notice them. The food in the city is pretty basic, unless you go for the high class places. You will find a couple of Irish bars and 1 Scottish bar with not an Irishman or Scot in sight unless they happen to be customers. Plenty of Tapas bars. I would stress the food isn't bad, just limited choice. If you decide to go, I would advise you learn some Spanish or take a phrase book with you as there isn't a lot of English spoken and menus are almost always in Spanish or other languages, but not English. There are a few, but not many. The train station is about a twenty minute walk, keep going past the information centre for about a hundred yards or so and turn right, Station is about 50 yards along. Arrive very early for your desired train as ticket machines didn't work and you will find yourself in a queue which moves at a snails pace waiting to purchase tickets. Trains go to Alicante in one direction and Murcia in the other. Back to the hotel, the food in the cafeteria and restaurant is apparently very good. We didn't try it but others said it was good. The star of the show is the swimming pool, never crowded, could have done with a few more sunbeds. In my opinion this is not a hotel for a family with kids because of it's quiet location, more suited I feel for couples who don't particularly want a beach holiday. Having said that I would highly recommend the hotel. I close with two little niggles, in case the hotel reads this, I booked a double room and pushing two single beds together does not constitute a double, which newlyweds wouldn't have appreciated, although we didn't fall into that bracket, and the second niggle is even more trivial. I had to ask several times on a daily basis for shampoo in the bathroom, which was part of the deal only to be given a couple of 20ml sachets which last for one shower each. So, overall conclusion, first class hotel, with almost nothing to fault.

We were a group of more than 30 people and we stood in this hotel for a weekend.
What I can say it's that the staff was great with us, specially during saturday night, as we arrange a dinner for all of us and they make all.gif best to give us a great meal
For the rest, rooms are pretty big, a little.but old furnished, but clean and comfortable.
Swimming pool, ok, you can bring your drinks from the bar.
It's very well located, but a .car it's needed to get there.

Had to collect people from airport early morning so decided to do a bit of shopping in Elche and stay here overnight. Elche was great for shopping, possibly better than Alicante.
All staff were friendly and helpful, hotel was clean and comfortable. Bedroom was functional, nothing special, reasonably large and with a well appointed bathroom. Hotel has a calm feeling to it and is well located; ten minutes walk from the old town and on the other side of the city to the shopping centres, industrial estates and the big shopping complexes.
Breakfast was good value.
All in all a good hotel, well positioned, easy to find and providing good value for money.

The hotel is as you expected. Good hotel, good rooms, nothing special but good service and friendly staff.
Good breakfast. Nice stay for a city visit but not a holiday feel. Parking on the premises but charge 6.50 which is not nessesary when you park in the restaurant area (was closed when we got there on a Thursday). The town has plenty of eateries so no need to stay at the hotel if you have a car. Good value for money, nothing spectacular.

titulo: Palms,water and comfort in the desert!
conteudo:
Palms,water ,confort after a long day in the desert!
Yes! Innthis part of Spain the view is mostly desert!We were here several times for business and returning to the hotel after a busy day is a blessing.
Rooms are large,nicely decorated with a local touch, very clean.
Stuff is welcoming you and the breackfast is authentical ! Have jamon and have a walk arround!

Stayed on October 18th for just one night. Flew into Alicante & waited 2 hours to get hire car, glad this hotel was nearby & easy to find. Appreciated the calm atmosphere & helpful reception staff. Room was fine, comfy & quiet. Evening meal in the lovely restaurant was superb. We were first ones in that evening (we're Brits!), so had undivided attention from the efficient waiter. Best meal we've ever had in Spain. Breakfast next morning also very good. Unusual place, it's a town full of palm tree gardens! Wished we could have stayed longer at this fab hotel.

titulo: Great hotel with top class food
conteudo:
We used this as an overnight stop due to its proximity to the main highway and reports of its great restaurant.

Very nice hotel, easy parking, large and pleasant double room and very friendly staff. But the restaurant was the starring role - someone who really knows his stuff in the kitchen.

A cheap breakfast compared to others (reduced to ‚Ç¨8.50 if booked the previous evening) - the best we had on our 12 day trip through France & Spain - and with eggs and bacon, not just continental!

Highly recommended for a stop over.

titulo: Lovely hotel with a great pool
conteudo: We've stayed at this hotel a few times as we have friends in Elche. It is clean and friendly, lovely breakfast. The pool is never too busy with a bar and towels for guests, very relaxing. Would recommend.

titulo: The best for a simple reason...
conteudo:
...the best thing in elche is the palm tree garden..and the Jardin Milenio is just in the middle of it. You can take a walk in a really suggestive palm garden just walking out your room.
I travelled a lot to Elche for job and after different hotels I decided to come back always to Milenio. Rooms are clean, it's in the middle of the nature at 5 mins to the city center, there is a 20mts outdoor swimming pool, sauna and gym, the restaurant LA TAULA is a fantastic designed glass box in the middle of the trees, cool. Wi-fi is free. Parking outside on the road is suggested, you can save the parking hotel fees.

We‚Äôve stayed at this Hotel several times and have always found the service to be good, the rooms clean and the pool wonderful. This year the service at the pool was rather slow, and there were rather a lot of flies, which although not the hotel‚Äôs fault is worth noting. Because this is a business hotel the pool is often very quiet‚Ä¶ if you are lucky you may have it to yourself. I would recommend this hotel and will be returning.

We stayed here and at its sister hotel the Huerto del Cura; both are affiliate hotels of the Paradors and the excellent standards show: the food (La Taura), grounds, rooms and service were impeccable; only the location was better at the Huerto del Cura, although that was very good indeed too. There was a swimming pool too at both and plenty of parking. We had a great time at both and only switched because my partner is disabled and found the walk from the Hotel Huerto del Cura into town easier.

We found the name of the Hotel on tripadvisor on the net and phoned .Got a price quoted and booked.As we drove into Elche we followed the signs for the hotel, very clearly marked.Once at the Hotel we asked to change the room to a large bed instead of two smaller one .This was done at no extra charge.The whole Hotel smelled fresh and clean , the same as our room.The room being very spacious and with a large bathroom.The pool was large and clean and a welcome after a hot day on the road.We ate in the cafeteria were the service was impeccable like the food .In the evening we ate in the restaurant in the garden amongst the trees.Once again fod and wine was perfect as was the waiting team.The following day we ate in the cafeteria at lunch and restaurant in the evening again .Perfect as before ,we did not take breakfast in the hotel as we like the spain tosard's on the streetside cafe's.Personnel were proffessional, and most helpful and always ready to advise.The parking at 6 euro's a day was cheap for a guarded car park.All in all it was a wonderful stay with no hiccup's.
as someone said here the other guests were the one who were notvery correct , at five in the morning talking loud in the corridor show some peoples respect for other.Lucky we were already up as we left for the airport.Once again the wake up call was on time.All these little things go to make a wonderful stay and we fully recommend this hotel.Its position in Elche is perfect too.

titulo: Nice hotel, friendly staff, good location...noisy dogs!
conteudo:
My wife and I stayed two nights at Hotel Jardin Milenio in March and I must admit the place is excellent value for money.

Located 5 minutes walk from the town center and the Huerta Del Cura, opposite a peaceful palm grove, the hteol is clean and tastefully decorated, the staff are friendly without being patronising, our room was large and the rooms facilities (shower, mini bar, TV) worked perfectly.

Our only complaint would be that the rear of the hotel backs onto an area with several temporary buildings. The residents keep a number of dogs and the frequent barking kept us awake at night. So if you are a light sleeper, ask for a room that doesn't face the courtyeard.

The hotel is situated amongst the palm groves of Elche, a short walk from the centre of the historic old town, and also a short distance from the lovely gardens of the Huerto del Cura. The room was spacious and spotlessly clean. The first night we had a problem with the next door neighbours who seemed to spend the night marching up and down their room but, after they checked out the following day we never heard a sound from the room.
We did not eat in the restaurant but did try a menu del d√≠a in the cafeteria which was excellent. The breakfasts were also very good.We found all the staff very helpful, particularly the waitress in the cafeteria who obligingly made sandwiches for my husband, who has a stomach problem, out of the normal kitchen hours.
The parking was reasonably priced and secure. All in all a very good hotel which we would both recommend and use again

The Hotel Jard√≠n Milenio is close to the old centre of Elche. It is a modern hotel decorated and furnished in minimalist style, though its wipe-clean designer-style does give the public areas a slightly austere aspect.

The bedrooms are spacious, the beds comfortable and the bathrooms well-appointed. The windows have both shutters and double-glazing, so there was no external noise, but the door-closers were highly-powered, which meant that sometimes there was some noise of banging doors coming from the corridor. The television was Spanish Freeview, with no English channels, but there is free Wi-Fi.

We needed a meal after arriving quite late. Because the restaurant was closed for its winter break, we found that the cafeteria was serving a menu del dia at 12.5 euros, including drinks, which had a reasonably good selection of dishes and was efficiently served. However, there was only one waiter who spoke English and anyone with not much Spanish might struggle a little as there was no translated menu. In the morning there is an extensive breakfast buffet, though this is extra.

The staff generally were very friendly and helpful, everywhere was spotlessly clean and this hotel is clearly a firm favourite with the business community.

It is good value, too, at this time of year and makes an excellent base for touring the area.

titulo: Very nice hotel on the outskirts of Elche
conteudo: The hotel is situated in very nice grounds within the Palm Grove, from where it's an easy walk into town. There's a swimming pool, which I didn't use as it was quite cold. The rooms are modern and spacious, although they are not very well soundproofed as I could hear noise coming from adjacent rooms and the corridor. The staff are very friendly and the breakfasts are excellent by Spanish standards.

titulo: good hotel close to old town
conteudo:
We enjoyed a lovely large room overlooking the palm garden. There is a jogging track through the palm groves and the hotel has an outdoor swimming pool. A good breakfast was served in the coffee shop and a glass of sparkling carva and orange juice put us in the mood to explore Elche. By coincidence, we had arrived in time for Elche's colourful mediaeval fiesta which is held in the old town at the end of October and well worth a visit.
We spent a few interesting hours at the very excellent museum and took a walk around the botanical gardens. Tasty tapas are served at the restaurant de Paris in the old town.
If returning to Elche, we would stay again at the hotel Jardin Milenio

We stayed at the millenium hotel in october wih our kids. We were visiting family for an event and found the hotel charming, quiet and clean.
The reception staff were lovely and very helpful.
Our room was spacious and modern. Our kids' bed setee could have been bigger but it made no difference as they slept well.
The breakfast was abundant and based on local products, plenty of fruit and buns!
A very family friendly hotel.

Set in a forest of palm trees, our room looked out onto a courtyard. The hotel is immaculately clean and the rooms are huge. You can't beat it for value for money (only 70 Euros for a room) and everyone is charming. We stayed here twice in two weeks as we had to meet friends, however Elche itself is not the greatest place to visit and it can be confusing getting to the hotel, but it is worth it.

We ate in the restaurant which was just alright, nothing special. Breakfast in the cafeteria was alright as well.

Read the reviews and booked. Found the reviews to be totally accurate. Great value - very pleasant and relaxing. Pool amazing if short on sun loungers. Breakfast great and very pleasant staff - well worth the four stars. Not much in the town but Alicante close - so hire a car!

Fantastic hotel in the middle of palm gardens, we got the bus from airport and got off in elche town. Hotel well signposted, 15 min stroll. Taxi ‚Ç¨18 recommend this for ease. On arrival warm greating, nice reception area with pc and free internet, and printer, handy for boarding cards. Rooms are placed over three floors with a lift. Our ground floor room was big with relaxing seating area, sofabed, looking onto a lovely courtyard. Mini bar, tv, free internet pc point, don't think WiFi.very big bathroom with traditional basket of accessories razor, toothbrush, comb etc. Crisp linen bedding, almost silent air con. Breakfast may appear expensive, but its the best spread I have ever had, served 7 to 11 each day. Attention to display detail is wonderful - boiled eggs served in individual glass on a red lettuce leaf. Lots different meats, cheeses, breads and fruits, fruit salads finely chopped are delicious. Hot and cold drinks, freshly squeezed Orange juice, chilled water and champagne, yes, champagne every morning. A lovely bucks fuzz to start your day. The swimming pool is just a short walk from hotel entrance, surrounded by jasmine, olive, orange and palm trees, spotless and very relaxing. Plenty sun beds, shaded areas, pool bar. Children's playground, small gym, monitors did not work but equipment fine if you needed yr gym fix. Bus stop into centre at end of road, stroll through palmarie opposite, or through footpath to left to small town area, local tapas bars, but be warned, not many places open until 9 pm, and on Sundays don't seem to open at all. Hotel has 24 hr room service, snack and a la carte menus. Prices reasonable and looked delicious. A delightful find, very clean and relaxing, worth every penny and will be returning again.

titulo: Perfect for a quiet week in the sun
conteudo:
We just wanted a quiet, hassle-free week in the sun and this hotel suited us perfectly. Despite being there in August the hotel felt very quiet and we were often the only people on the terrace, which is a lovely peaceful area to sit and read, surrounded by palm trees (as you are everywhere in Elche).
