Cuarto de ba√±o cutre con cortina rastrera en la ba√±era. Al abrir el grifo de dicha ba√±era hay olor a ca√±er√≠a.
Como premio una u√±a reseca encima de la encimera del ba√±o.
Por no haber no hay ni minibar.
- Se celebran multitud de eventos (bodas y dem√°s celebraciones) por lo que la tranquilidad brilla por su ausencia.
Nosotros no volvemos. Considero que por 94‚Ç¨ la noche se puede pedir un poco m√°s.

Se trata de un hotel diferente, donde las habitaciones son bungalows. Ademas se respira paz y tranquilidad en dicho hotel.
El hotel dispone de una gran piscina y un jardin para pasear.
El trato del personal fue agradable y cordial

Lugar √∫nico. Una estancia maravillosa. El maitre Leopoldo se encargo de cuidarnos durante la cena, comida y desayuno. Un 10. Lo que m√°s me gusto fue el entorno selv√°tico, la paz que se respira. El personal es simpatiqu√≠simo y muy atento. La habitaci√≥n acogedora.

Decepcionante,
No se corresponden las fotos de la web con la realidad. Cierto es que son bungalows pero la calidad de la habitaci√≥n es de un dos estrellas. Nunca he visto un 4 estrellas con cortinilla en la ba√±era, el estado de las paredes de la habitaci√≥n p√©simo, no hay persianas y entra demasiada luz por las ma√±anas pues las cortinas no cierran correctamente. La se√±al de wifi mal√≠sima. Me siento enga√±ado por lo que vi en la web y lo que he comprobado en la realidad. No pienso volver.

Estuve el puente de mayo en este hotel. El personal amable, las habitaciones, que son bungalows dentro del recinto, sobrias pero agradables, la zona de piscina tambi√©n muy agradable y el restaurante del hotel me gust√≥ mucho.

El √∫nico inconveniente fue la coincidencia con un bautizo un d√≠a y una boda en otro, pero lo tienen bien organizado y las molestias para el h√∫esped son m√≠nimas pero molestias al fin.

Como siempre que hemos estado en dicho hotel la satisfacci√≥n es enorme. En general todo es perfecto, limpieza, ruido, cercan√≠a al centro y para coger salidas de carretera, etc.. Mi √∫nica cr√≠tica es el precio que es un poco alto. PERO EN GENERAL SALVO EN ESO LE DOY UN 10

titulo: CUANDO LOS EMPLEADOS NO TRABAJAN FELICES...
conteudo: Durante muchos a√±os me ha rondado la idea de organizar un evento en el Hotel Huerto del Cura.Su entorno y situaci√≥n me parec√≠an un lugar id√≠lico para ello y mi fallo estuvo en decidirme simplemente por la est√©tica y arquitectura sin analizar previamente el personal humano que lo gestiona.Contrat√© sus servicios de sala de conferencias, coffee y cena c√≥ctel para mi equipo y 100 clientes y todav√≠a estoy esperando a que alguien de su personal me pregunte si est√° todo bien o si necesitamos algo......la √∫nica vez que se dirigieron a m√≠ fu√© para decirme despu√©s de la cena que si podr√≠an servirnos algo en la terraza pero ten√≠amos que pagarlo, que desfachatez la nuestra pensar en consumir y en no pagar unos refrescos.....!!!!!Algo triste y desmotivador se respira en ese hotel y en su personal, as√≠ que si su motivo de contrataci√≥n es celebrar algo,no intente compartirlo con ellos.Por destacar algo de la gesti√≥n humana, dar las gracias a Raul del servicio de sonido que ha sido el √∫nico que ha justificado su profesionalidad.

Hotel tranquilo, amplio, con zonas ajardinadas agradables y gran piscina exterior tranquila.
Personal agradable.
Restaurante suficiente con precios adecuados.
Dif√≠cil aparcar en las inmediaciones a determinadas horas.

En plena ciudad de Elche a pocos minutos del centro existe un para√≠so tropical, donde atraviesas una puerta y te encuentras una vegetaci√≥n exuberante, de varias clases y muchas palmeras, que te transportan al Caribe, sus habitaciones distribuidas en bungalows te a√≠slan de la gente incluso que se encuentra alojada en otras caba√±as cercanas, una maravilla.

Es un bonito hotel con un entorno maravilloso, rodeado de vegetaci√≥n y jardines. Destacar la distribuci√≥n de las habitaciones tipo bungalow, como si se tratara de un resort del Caribe. Al estar en el mismo centro de Elche, no te esperas un lugar as√≠.

La habitaci√≥n era muy bonita y acogedora (ten√≠amos reservada una Doble Superior pero nos dieron una Junior Suite), aunque se notaba un poco la antig√ºedad, sobre todo en el ba√±o.

El desayuno y la cena bastante buenos. El servicio tambi√©n.

Es un hotel muy bonito, con una vegetaci√≥n maravillosa, tranquilo y muy c√≥modo.
El personal es muy amable.
A mejorar: aunque las habitaciones est√°n bien, todo se nota que tiene muchos a√±os, ba√±era, grifer√≠a, armarios.
Tambi√©n el precio del desayuno buffet a 14 euros nos pareci√≥ excesivo.

Todo perfecto, instalaciones, servicio, habitaciones, restauraci√≥n, personal.. igual es uno de los mejores hoteles de Espa√±a. Volveremos en otra ocasi√≥n!!! Nuestra estancia por por San Valent√≠n (febrero 2015)

Muy aconsejable para disfrutar del comfort.
La √∫nica cosa a mencionar de insatisfactorio, es que llam√© para confirmar la reserva y anunci√© que se trataba de una noche de bodas, para que tuvieran una deferencia con nosotros, y as√≠ me lo hizo saber la persona que me atendi√≥, pero luego llegada dicha noche, no hubo ning√∫n tipo de detalle al respecto.

Magn√≠fico hotel rodeado de vida y tranquilidad, el establecimiento muy acogedor por su entorno y tipo de hu√©sped. El servicio es agradable y las habitaciones de gran calidad. Lo recomiendo en especial para parejas.

Impresionante la habitacion 216 con ba√±era con chorros de agua, grandiosa, limpia y extraordinaria. El restaurant precio calidad buenisimo. Trato personal genial. Impresionante jardin con sus habitaciones bungalots. Repeteria sin dudarlo.

Me sorprendieron la distribucuon de las habitaciones, peque√±os bungalows. La cocina exquita y precios razonables. El Desayuno muy completo, La pena es que era invierno y no disfrute de la piscina, tendre que volver

he pasado un fin de semana y ha sido incre√≠ble,estupendas instalaciones,rodeada de mucha vegetaci√≥n ,tranquilo y silencioso,despertar escuchando a los pajaros en pleno centro de la ciudad es impensable,servicio muy correcto ,desayuno estupendo.Muy limpio y supercuidado,en verano debe ser incre√≠ble.Volveremos seguro

Hemos estado este fin de semana y la verdad que nos ha encantado. Las habitaciones rodeadas por todas partes de palmeras, todo muy bien cuidado y muy limpio.
Solo un pero, la ducha era una pesadilla. No salia el agua caliente constante, y cada ducha era un suplicio. Por lo dem√°s todo perfecto. Volveremos...

Es un hotel al estilo del caribe con un jard√≠n con mucha vegetaci√≥n y bungalow. .fabuloso en invierno. .en verano me lo imagino a√∫n mejor con la piscina y la terraza.
La √∫nica pega q cobren igual por tener el coche en exterior q en parking subterr√°neo.,deberian cobrar menos en exterior.
Y otra cosa, el desayuno fabuloso pero ,por favor que vayan recogiendo los platos de las mesas,que es muy incomodo desayunar con todos los platos sucios al lado.
Aparte de esas cosas, un hotel muy recomendado y c√©ntrico! !!

Nos alojamos en este hotel porque tuvimos una boda. El precio -como √≠bamos con la boda- no fue alto. La habitaci√≥n muy bien, son villas independientes muy acogedoras. El entorno tambi√©n excelente. Est√° tambi√©n muy cerca del centro de la ciudad Elche. Sin duda una buena elecci√≥n.

Es un hotel formado por peque√±as construcciones en medio de un jard√≠n tropical ,aunque en esta √©poca del a√±o hace bastante fr√≠o y humedadc, las habitaciones reformadas ,con buena calefacci√≥n y el desayuno muy completo con con productos de la zona

titulo: si quieres disfrutar,,este hotel es ideal!!!
conteudo: Desde hace mucho a√±os conozco este hotel, y cada vez que voy solo puedo decir que como los buenos vinos mejora con los a√±os, si dejar de actualizarse. Es un para√≠so caribe√±o en el centro de una magn√≠fica ciudad para visita . Y lo mejor que cada vez es mas diicil encontrar tiene un restaurante dentro acorde con su calidad como hotel. El capellans,, ! Este hotel se puede recomendar sin ning√∫n tipo de dudas.

hotel horizontal en el jardin hay mucha vegetaci√≥n, lleno de bungalows de 4 habitaciones.
Habitaciones amplias y bien decoradas, lugar muy tranquilo para pasar unas vacaciones. Personal muy agradable. En el recepci√≥n a la entrada la recepcionista tard√≥ un poco en hacer el checkin porque estaba haciendo varias cosas a la vez.
Si vuelvo a la ciudad repetir√© hotel.

Me he hospedado en tres ocasiones en este hotel en viaje de trabajo. Y volver√©, siempre me siento c√≥moda y bien atendida, el personal es muy correcto y amable. Me gusta la decoraci√≥n de las habitaciones (bungalows) con un estilo asi√°tico, un tama√±o mediano, el desayuno es variado estilo buffet, por poner una pega quiz√° podr√≠an mejorar un poco el ba√±o. Siempre pido la cena en la habitaci√≥n y la comida es estupenda y con buenas raciones. Parking propio de pago 13 ‚Ç¨/ noche. Es agradable pasear por el palmeral aunque por la noche estando sola da un poco de respeto. Repetir√© sin duda.

He estado en el hotel tanto en una boda como en un fin de semana en pareja. A parte de que el entorno es espectacular, hay que valorar su gastronom√≠a; la carta es inmejorable y llama la atenci√≥n que sean capaces de preparar platos tan exquisitos y cuidados tambi√©n en ocasiones especiales, cuando el n√∫mero de comensales es muy alto. Esto es dif√≠cil de encontrar en otros hoteles.

Como punto m√°s flojo, por poner algo: es verdad que sus habitaciones son bastante sencillas. En todo caso, son acojedoras, est√°n muy limpias y se descansa de cine al ser un lugar tan tranquilo.

Volver√© sin duda

Es la primera vez que pongo una cr√≠tica, pero es que me ha decepcionado tanto este hotel que espero de que con ella ayude a los futuros clientes.
Es un hotel con precios de cinco estrellas con una calidad de tres, siendo generoso.
La habitaci√≥n ol√≠a fatal, el mobiliario viejo, falta de mantenimiento y eso que estaba hospedado una doble superior, no quiero ni pensar c√≥mo ser√° la est√°ndar.
Estaba alojado en r√©gimen de media pensi√≥n (grave error), me dijeron que la cena constaba de tres platos a elegir de la carta, que en principio no ten√≠a mala pinta, mi pareja y yo entendimos que era a elegir entre los platos de la carta del restaurante, como hacen en otros hoteles que hemos estado hospedados (otro grave error),no por lo contrario nos presentan en un vulgar hoja, a elegir entre tres entrantes de pena, los segundos compuestos de pizza, espaguetis, calamar o carrilleras y postre, todo por el m√≥dico precio de m√°s de 29‚Ç¨ sin incluir la bebida. Si se√±or director el comedor muy bonito, y con glamur, pero la pizza y la pasta como que no le va, quieren aparentar algo que no son.
Yo me tome de primero gazpacho de mel√≥n (tome una muestra para mandarlo a cuarto milenio, aun estoy buscando el mel√≥n), ni por decir el calamar la guarnici√≥n me la dejaron caer en el plato de cualquier manera (el bar del barrio presenta los platos mucho mejor que ustedes), sin mencionar el calamar, fresco, fresco. El coste de este men√∫ seguro que no alcanza ni los seis euros, por lo que si lo cobran a 29‚Ç¨ se podr√≠an currar un poco mejor el men√∫.
Todo no es malo en el hotel, el desayuno es lo √∫nico que se salva.
Ah, que no les ubiquen en la 217 que tiene los motores de refrigeraci√≥n a mismo costado, eso s√≠, se oye poco los motores, si, pero desde la recepci√≥n.
Aun me quedan m√°s cr√≠ticas pero estoy cansado de escribir.
No pienso volver jam√°s a este hotel, ni yo, ni nadie de mi entorno.

Hotel muy recomendable en el centro de Elche, nos tir√°bamos buena parte del d√≠a en la piscina con una leve sensaci√≥n de estar en el caribe, con las palmeras, el sol, los c√≥cteles...

Las habitaciones perfectas para pasar unos d√≠as, limpias y muy agradables, las recepcionistas muy simp√°ticas.

√önicas quejas, faltan personal o socorrista en la piscina, donde los clientes dejan la toalla durante todo el d√≠a y si te encantas un poco te quedas sin hamacas, y creo que siendo un hotel donde poder relajarse y desconectar sobran los ni√±os.

Volveremos.

Cura is by far my favourite hotel to date.

Firstly I love the layout, the grounds and overall outdoor area. Really is like paradise.

Secondly, the service is excellent. The staff are discreet, very helpful, lovely, the bathrooms are kitted our with essentials like toothbrush, paste, water, slippers and a variety of small washing gels.

There is parking available on site, it is walking distance from the Basilica and the main tourist area.

I stayed in the suite with a large poster bed. Such a beautiful space, simple yet memorable decor and laid out well so that you can really enjoy the space.

I‚Äôll be staying here again on my next trip to Elche!

titulo: Great pool - super value for money
conteudo:
Elche is worth a visit - lovely squares and shops, plus the beautiful gardens and palms.
We‚Äôve been coming here for many years as we have Spanish friends in the city.
The pool is the star, reception a bit hit and miss, but perfectly fine.
Our room near the pool was refurbished but very dark and hardly any storage. Bed was too firm, so that coupled with the noise from outside, made for difficult sleep.
Breakfast is really good, nice fresh selection.
Service and food at the restaurant not great, but convenient.
The jacuzzi was great (need to book) I also enjoyed a good facial.
Overall another great stay.

According to the misleading hotel website, you could think that it's much better than it actually is. It is the closest place to an all-inclusive hotel in the Caribbean that I have seen in Spain, although it's not cheap at all. Correct but simple room, a pool area barely to cool off and a breakfast passed by the skin of its teeth. Best of all: the restaurant and its staff, since they committed a mistake and they offered us ham on the house while we waited.

Couldnt fault the place. Car parking is easy, great quality breakfast. The restaurant, reception and the room is of an excellent specification. One of the best hotels we have stayed in. Would be happy to stay there longer but unfortunately it was only one night ....

Upon check-in in my bungalow The first thing I saw was a dead rat in the bush, just in front of the room door. Not the nicest welcome ever. People I traveled with Wanted to change the hotel right away, but we told ourselves that things like this can happen if there is a garden.
However what is inexcusable is the attitude of the hotel staff to the dead rat experience. I went to the reception twice to ask that somebody cleans that mess, but the rat stayed there till the end of the stay next morning. Not only disgusting, but what about the hygiene?! No any special reaction from the reception or management either, Just a weak ‚Äúoh, sorry, I will tell someone‚Äù
Other than that: advantages - beautiful grounds, good location, good buffet breakfast disadvantages- inattentive staff, long lines for check in (one person at the desk on Friday afternoon when the long 4 day weekend begins), expensive parking and the above rat problem that nobody cared to solve
I don‚Äôt think I will stay there again

I remembered this hotel because I new the owner at that time, 35 years ago.
It has been bought by a chain.
bedrooms are standard with nothing special. Clean, though. I paid around 85‚Ç¨ per night. There is not even shampoo or shower gel in the bathroom.
The restaurant is very average, outrageously expensive (around 60‚Ç¨/person) with a very bad service. They push you to eat so quickly because they are in e hurry to close. I had my plate taken while I was not finished yet.
I really don't recommend this place. The garden by the swimming pool is beautiful but this is the only thing that remain from the previous owner.

Beautiful hotel, outstanding service and the most delicious food. We loved every minute of our stay. Most comfortable bed I have ever slept on. Buffet breakfast with a show cooking hot hot food. Great room service. Big pool and if not too busy plenty of sun lounges.

Been here many times, this is maybe one of our hidden gems nr. 1. This place is amazing. It is centrally located in a non tourist area of Elche and the athmpsphere is simply fantastic. Cant be desribed, the bungalows. the pool, the bar area, we will always feel that this has a special place in our hearts...

The hotel rooms are in some type of bungalow, which are located in a beautifull set garden. Gives you immediately a calm feeling. The room is relatively big, and comfortable. Breakfast is a big buffet for whatever you would like.

Yes, all the positives are correct, but, we are also staying here because we got the impression it was quiet and peaceful. The pool area has Kango‚Äôs and hammer drills playing in stereo. So we went to the Zen garden. Bound to be peaceful there. Workmen shouting and hammering, drilling and guys with hard hats and wheelbarrows everywhere!
We complained, mostly to check if they had a quiet time during the day. No, we were assured it starts at 8 and finishes at 6! No discounts or concessions were offered. So we went back to our room, which we were assured was at the end of the garden away from the noise. So this morning, a man with a deafening leaf blower was walking up and down our veranda continuously. After 10 mins I asked him to go away, but he was soon back again just standing outside with it. Again I asked him to go away, but apparently he was working.
Will go for lunch and dinner outside the hotel today, which wasn‚Äôt the plan. Can‚Äôt wait to get away tomorrow.

titulo: Lovely hotel set in a Palm Tree Garden
conteudo: The setting is superb. Very comfortable bungalow accommodation set in a large palm tree garden. There is a super pool area. The food and service was generally very good. This hotel is quite unique and different and is also very close to the main town and shopping area. I can thoroughly recommend this hotel.

The hotel location and ambience are outstanding. Our personal experience from reception staff was very under whelming. Customer service sadly missing. Didnt apply to all. Strange for a hotel to say check in at 4pm when the kitchen also closes at 4pm. So only a very bland sandwich available to eat. Bed made and towels changed but glasses not emptied or cleaned. I don't mind cleaning my own glass but i always thought that is what room service did. Look very carefully to discover they have bacon and sausages for breakfast, cook in the garden eat inside, yes of course i love cooking in the garden but its November and all the guests are eating inside. Shame, we really looked forward to this hotel. Thanks to the reception staff on duty after 4 on our arrival who were extremely friendly. Keys not working when we returned to hotel on our second day. Pool area is glorious.

titulo: A beautiful setting for a lovely meal
conteudo: I recently visited this hotel to eat in the restaurant and had a wonderful experience. We strolled the beautiful gardens before dinner and had a relaxing and fun evening. All staff were excellent - welcoming and friendly. We were well taken care of, especially as being vegetarian required the front of house and kitchen staff to be flexible and accommodating - which they were. The food was tasty and we were served with care and attention at the table. I look forward to staying here when I'm next in Spain.

titulo: Lovely setting in the palm trees
conteudo: First impressions of this hotel are fantastic, set amongst the palm trees of Elche. Lovely hotel but bit of a trek to the bungalows you stay in, in the grounds. We stayed in room 254 , on opening the door we were hit by the smell of damp. Unusual in a hot country! This hotel is a member of the Prestige hotels of the world and as so details should matter. The bathroom door did`nt close properly and the rain shower lacked a shelf for soap/shampoo. Also trying to get a drink at the bar took forever. If the management could sort out the details this wouild be a fantastic hotel

The room was a little basic but they are doing them up. Our room was ok but not as good as the photos on this page. The setting was great and that made up for it. I'd recommend taking mosquito replellant if you sit out in the evening.The staff were very good.

Stayed here for 3 nights and rooms were a little dissapointing. Staff were helpful but had to look at 4 rooms before we found one that we were happy with. Some of rooms been upgraded, some not, but upgrading is shoddy in places. Good in restaurant not brilliant but eating outside at pool area was lovely.

Mostly bungalow accommodation set in a beautiful palm grove with sub tropical plantings and attractive pool area and seating. The hotel building is charming and has a separate breakfast area by the pool and an excellent restaurant and bar inside the main building.
Better explanations about the a/c system are necessary. Fortunately we were there for two nights. If we had only stayed for one my review would have been very bad. We had a terrible first night. We could not turn off the a/c or find any way to adjust the settings. Also too much light came through the curtains. Our complaints were dealt with the next morning. The annoying outside light can be dimmed a little by sliding an external shutter. More importantly we were shown that the a/c control unit is on the wall by the external door handle and not on the wall near the a/c unit. It cannot be controlled from the right hand side of the bed, only by leaning to the left from the left hand side of the bed. I do not know if this applies to other rooms but if you have problems with the a/c not responding look for a small lighted button in an obscure position!
Once that was sorted we enjoyed our stay. The bed was comfortable. The food and drink was good. Service was good. Don‚Äôt miss the palm museum close by.

titulo: Great staff and food but the facilities are not very wheelchair friendly and parking charges are extortionate
conteudo:
The staff in the restaurants and the room staff were superb, they were exceptionally helpful and kind, this meant a great deal to my wife and I as she needs a wheelchair to get around and it is not always easy to manoeuvre around seating areas. The food was absolutely excellent and there was a wide variety too.

The hotel is not very wheelchair friendly, the pathways to the chalet-style rooms is very uneven and it took 2 s before we were offered a ramp into the room. To get to the breakfast area there were two steps to go down, eventually we found a door that had to be unlocked to get in via a ramped entrance, but each day of our four day visit this had to be unlocked. The 13 Euro a day parking charge is extortionate, especially for a Blue Badge holder.

We chose the hotel because it was away from the coast and set amongst palm trees.
Beautiful hotel very crisp marble features inside and well laid out. Accommodation set in the grounds in bungalows.
Very clean and spacious with full facilities. Air conditioners very important as the temperature hit the mid thirties in late September.
Staff very attentive and work really hard.
We found some very good restaurants locally a few in glorietta square better than most.
On site restaurant recommended if you like more complex dishes but as they sat outside in evening
Midges were an issue.
There is an air conditioned restaurant and cafe.
Would recommend for relaxing holiday .
Only drawback we found was lack of English spoken.
But many nationalities welcomed here.

Set among palm trees we enjoyed a tranquil stay in one of the bungalow styled rooms of this 4star hotel.
The service was discreet and friendly and the enthusiastic and smiling breakfast staff deserve a special mention!
Our room was large and restful and the communal areas were spacious and calm.
It felt almost like a retreat.

Had a holiday within a holiday and stayed here the night, last night - great to be able to walk into Elche for its restaurants and shops.
The best hotel breakfast I have had in European hotel, so much choice, really lovely.
Check in was slightly shambolic, don‚Äôt think their system was working correctly. Check out was slow too.
Nice bedroom and staff. Lovely, if a little chilly swimming pool.
I will definitely return.

Pros: Lovley place, clean everywhere. Staff were friendly and respectful. Had a nice pool and a great mix of visitors from all over the world. Breakfast had loads of choice.

Cons: expensive for spa but there is an inpedendent spa oppersite which is amazing but non English speaking, called Hermes Wellness Centro . The bar is expensive and doesn't have a big cocktail choice. The hotel needs more signs for direction.

They did have 3 big weddings on when we arrived which made it hard to relax but they all left by lunch the next day.

This is a pacel for calm and relax, not to left go and be crazy and free. It's all so seriuos üòä

titulo: Complete lack of caring for guests
conteudo:
I was looking after a big group of friends using this hotel last year. A minor criticism was that, during our stay, the front-of-house staff were surprisingly slow. They had to check almost everything with an unseen person in an inner office.
What was worse, though, was the experience of organising a drinks reception in the garden, which I started to do months in advance. The date and price of the party (drinks and tapas nibbles) were confirming (in writing) as 35 euro per person but after I'd paid 200 euros deposit, the hotel put the price up by 2 euros per person. They also said the earliest start time was 8.30pm as the kitchen opened then. When I protested they said there had been an involuntary misunderstanding about the price - even when I sent a copy of the email exchange - and when I begged to have drinks and cold nibbles like nuts and crisps earlier and hot tapas from 8.30pm they refused. When the time came, the staff only STARTED putting out the glasses, drinks and tapas at 8.30pm. Tapas were meant to be labelled so you could know what you were eating (important for some who had food intolerances) but the part of the garden where the food was served had such poor lighting and by 8.45-ppm it was so dark that nobody could read what the labels said. The lack of concern for guests was amazing.
Beautiful gardens and lovely chalet bedrooms among the palms.

Just returned from 5 nights at this wonderful hotel ,lovely rooms in bungalow type buildings set in lovely gardens and palm trees with a nice pool .the hotel is 4 star and unpretentious, but offers very good service in nice surroundings a few minutes walk from the town centre
We were only in Elche as the father in law was having a major operation at excellent Vinolopo hospital ,but I have to say Elche is worth a visit at any time it‚Äôs a lovely small city with a vibrant atmosphere and a multitude of shops restaurants & bars ,we thoroughly enjoyed our stay

titulo: A gorgeous oasis in the heart of Elche
conteudo:
Tall Palm trees and lush vegetation makes it feel like you are in Mauritius or Bali. The chalet-style bedrooms are modern and clean and very comfortable.
The grounds are tranquil and well maintained.
The Arabic/Asian decor adds to the feeling that you are in a far more exotic location,
The swimming pool provides much-needed relief from the heat and wasn't that busy the few days we were there,
We had some of the best Mojitos at the bar next to the pool!!
Breakfast is really good, with a continental buffet, and now hot food cooked to order by the chef.
The staff are very friendly and were very accommodating.
The hotel has its own car park at 13 Euros per day for guests. You also get discounted entrance to the Huerto de Cura Botanical Garden which is well worth visit.
A Fantastic Hotel which we hope to visit again very soon.

¬∑ Things to note:
Check-in is at 4.00pm so don't arrive too early. Although you can use the bar or pool while you are waiting.
There is a 10 Euro deposit for towels to use by the pool.

titulo: Nice location - service at hotel could improve
conteudo:
Stayed for two night in Huerto Del Cura - location of hotel is very nice, in the middle of the palm oasis. This gives the hotel a nice and relaxing cachet.

The hotel has underground parking - which is nice if you travel by car and want to keep the climate in the car under controle :)

Check in was a long process - lots of time spent behind the computer, whereas this is done way faster in the other hotels we stayed in during our trip in Spain. Check-in staff is very friendly.

Rooms are OK but by far not the nicest we have seen - and both rooms we stayed in could use a refresh. Airco was working well. Our room had bath and shower combined which is not my preference.

Size of beds is small - not good for tall people and not good for couples... so certainly not good for tall couples ... so sleep quality is so-so. Also, sound isolation is not ideal so lot of noise from outside the room (people talking, people with roller bags, etc.).

Breakfast was mixed experience - quality of food is excellent - but getting hot food prepared in the morning is a true challenge since the cook seems to be an invisible ghost, and when he is behind his cooking gear, he was more working on cleaning the cooking station than on serving customers - we experienced this on every morning - so certainly a point of attention.

check out was efficient and correct.

overall a good stay but not a great stay - and breakfast experience could be much better.

I stayed there 3nights for business. The place is amazing, the pool is nice, a lotmof palm trees, pathway well maintained, at the pool you can seat around with a fresh drink, reception is friendly, service is quite quick at the pool...i had to go to the bar to order a beer after 10‚Äô seating on a chair.
The place is well maintained. The bedroom is clean and spacious but would need some up to date renovation.
I would be back to this hotel if I go back in this area!

I have no words to express my deception, they stole my 1,400.00 Euro belt and they refuse to take care responsability, stay away from these Crooks and they¬¥re pseudo hotel, I stay only at Four Seasons, Mandarin Oriental, St Regis, Ritz Carlton, I have never been robbed, unfortunately there is no good hotel to stay in Elche, NEVER AGAIN, rather stay in Alicante or somewhere else. Legal action must be taken. Agains this horrendous actions.

My husband and i stayed 1 night in this great hotel. The staff is very helpfull and friendly. The rooms are good. The garden is beautifull and the swimmingpool is great. We will come back in the future!

What a great hotel. Love the chalets and the garden. Next to the Huerto del Cura which was fantastic. Rooms good (although 121 could do with an extractor fan in the bathroom. Food excellent in the restaurant and breakfast outside even in a drizzle was good. Check in a bit slow but check out fast. Would return. Elche is a lovely city.

The good point is that the hotel is very well located in the heart of the palm grove. Services are limited, restaurant is average (but there are very good restaurant near the hotel) and bedroom are just ok. Elche is a beautiful town.

four of us stayed here for one night at the end of our two week stay in a villa just north of Alicante. One of the reasons for staying was to be near the airport for an early morning flight but also to be near the botanic gardens. The hotel is spread out in beautiful tropical grounds with most accommodation in bungalows although some were in a small complexes of about ten ot twelve rooms. Checking in is normally 4.00 p.m but we were able to have access at 12.30 and found the rooms both spacious, clean and well appointed. Staff at reception were particularly friendly and helpful. WE had breakfast outside the dining room in the morning sunshine, surrounded by palm trees that could have been in Singapore. There was a very good choice of cold buffet together with a personal service for hot food, delivered to your table. Our only concern was that on the evening the restaurant did not open until 8.30 p.m. which would not have been a problem except that we wanted to eat earlier due to having to get up early the next morning, Overall we were very pleased with the hotel and would gladly stay there again. And of course, the Botanic Gardens are immediately opposite the hotel and well worth a visit.

I forget the name of this restaurant situated in the hotel Del Cura. Anyway it's excellent. We spent a fabulous lunch with many delicious plates. The staff was very professionnal.
The garden is very appreciated too.

Good value and really good location just outside Elche. 10 min walk from Centre or less. Has a big swimming pool and a good breakfast room with lots of options. Air conditioning in room was good and large bathroom

Me and my partner stayed here for the night for our anniversary and loved it, the staff were so helpful and friendly and answered all questions about the area. Breakfast was included in our stay and was lovely. The room we stayed in was just how we expected the bed was amazing and so comfortable my partner was sad to leave the bed! All in all a brilliant hotel and will definitely stay again.

Rooms were clean, beds were confortable, service was amazing. We went there for a wedding and everything went out perfect. Just one complaint: breakfast should be included in the rate. In anyway, this does not change the fact that this hotel should be classified as a 5/5.

titulo: Lovely but let down by details
conteudo: A lovely hotel but let down by details. The hotel is 4 star but the service is 2 star. Finding staff in the bar was painful. Getting their attention in the restaurant ditto. The staff are friendly and helpful when they are there though. The outdoor furniture is a bit decrepit. No kettle in the rooms. Mean with the toiletries. Poor lighting in the room.

titulo: It must be the best in town.
conteudo: Elche is the palm groves, the Misteri d'Elx and then a charming Spanish town. The huge number of palms makes the town special and in the middle of the groves you will find the Hotel Huerto Del Cura which obviously is a popular place to stay and celebrate. Very spacious rooms (superior) with exquisite baths. It does not leave you much to doubt.

titulo: Unique and special gardens close to city centre
conteudo:
Fab breakfast, pool, reception and of course the wonderfully lush and tropical gardens. Enjoyed the bungalow/chalet room, and the bed was very comfortable. Shame we only had one chance to use the jacuzzi bath.

Extremely well situated for walking into the lovely city of Elche. Would visit again.

Note that the restaurant does not seem to cater for vegetarians.

Lovely quiet hotel, with separate rooms mostly on 1 level. Very busy at times, however hotel has large conference and reception areas. Fabulous breakfast, and dinner menu looked very good, however did not try. Lots of culture very close to hotel.

I love this hotel and have visited several times. The rooms are like a series of 'chalet' type buildings set within the fabulous botanical gardens. Their decor is more Asian than Mediterranean but perfectly complements the tranquil, almost meditative atmosphere than the hotel grounds exude. Calm and relaxing but be aware that sometimes large groups visit (especially at weekends) and then it can become busy but never rowdy. The pool is beautiful and rarely full and the perfect setting for settling down for a good read. The range at breakfast is excellent: seasonal fruit, vegetables, breads, cakes, cooked meats and eggs, yoghurt, cereal, etc. The coffee is from a machine but acceptable. The restaurant serves good quality dishes but I prefer to go out into town to experience the local establishments that all serve great authentic food (e.g. El Extremeno just across the road). A haven that I will return to year by year.

titulo: Oasis of calm within a lovely city
conteudo:
We‚Äôve stayed here many times, and it does not disappoint. The pool is the star of the show. Great for relaxing and enjoying a drink from the pool bar. The whole place is very clean, and service was efficient and friendly - one receptionist was grumpy but I‚Äôm overlooking that. The only negatives are that there was quite a lot of flies around the pool area - I‚Äôm brining fly killer spray next time - saying that it‚Äôs a hot country so goes with territory! And for us the bed was too hard.
We walked all over Elche and really enjoyed exploring this beautiful city. We hired a car and explored Alicante, Santa Pola and San Juan beach all under 30mins by car.

We stayed for 4 nights here and it was very relaxing. The pool area is lovely and chilled out. Our room was clean and the air conditioning worked perfectly. Wifi reception was great all over. The beds were a little hard and there were no tea or coffee making facilities in the room. At breakfast there was a chef to make fresh omelettes, bacon etc to your preference. Bring mosquito spray. I got badly bitten but that isn't the hotels fault!

When we arrived we had First lunch at the restaurant. That was a fabulous lunch. One of the best Since months. Great gourmet menu and nice ambiance. Wine list was great and very nice priced as well. Rooms are a little outdated but works for the weekend. Great pool with pool bar. Breakfast was awesome! Will visit his place again and recommendable for families. Very close to the Centre of town and 15 min taxi ride to the airport.

Lovely hotel. Great swimming pool and gardens. Brilliant restaurant as well as bar. Breakfast great. Rooms spacious but bed a little hard. Fantastic place to stay for a long weekend or bit longer. Really enjoyed our stay and will return.

Wow what a place! Beautiful hotel and grounds, clean and well maintained.professional,friendly staff. Had an issue with noise from some building work going on in the room next door early on in our stay and staff kindly moved us to an equally nice room. They also surprised us with a complimentary bottle of bubbly for the inconvenience.
The hotel is walking distance into the lovely ‚Äòpalm city‚Äô Elche. Views from the Basilica tower are worth a visit.
Wonderful relaxing break.
Thank you

Lovely find, booked as we wanted something a bit different and out of the way - this place is special, a lovely pool and gardens, but right at the heart of the city - just the right size to give everyone a bit of space - the music played at the bar could be updated, otherwise a very pleasant place for a week to get some RnR

Stayed here for two nights. You could be in a tropical country, the rooms are set out in amongst palm and gardens. Just beautiful. The restaurant was excellent we ate at the pool side and the taster menu was great value for money.
Pool was never too busy. A little paradise. Easy to walk to local attractions and views of palm city from Basilica de Santa Maria tower stunning.
Staff are all very pleasant and helpful. Will definitely bring staying again.

We loved the location of the hotel. A close 10 minute walk to the center of town. The bungalows are in a grove of palm trees and it has a tropical feeling. The rooms are very spacoius with large bathrooms.The swimming pool was excellent! We enjoyed the zen gardens. The main restaurant is excellent but you can also order from the pool area.

My daughter and I stayed in the hotel for two nights, treated ourselves to a junior suite, well worth the money, room was very nice, clean and spacious. Good breakfast and very helpful welcoming staff.

titulo: Great hotel near the Elche center
conteudo: Spacious room and bathroom. Clean. Comfortable beds. Beautiful garden. Nice pool to relax by in the sun. Very friendly staff. Peaceful stay. And only a few minutes walk to restaurants and shops in Elche. You don't need a car. Take a taxi from the airport.

Staying at the Hotel Huerto always reminds me of staying in the Caribbean. The tropical gardens, the great pool and rooms in the separate villas is so unlikely in the middle of a city. And yet you can walk to all the best tourist and shopping areas. All that's missing is the beach!

Lovely rooms in an oasis, staff were polite swimming pool was lovely, sauna room, loved the zen garden. A very peaceful stay here. Town a ten minute walk away with lots of shops and places to eat. Certainly will be returning next year.

The rooms and bathrooms were quite spacious and situated in the shady gardens. There was a lovely pool to relax by in the sun, but a waiter service for drinks would have enhanced the relaxation. The checking in was quite slow and cumbersome, and a porter service would be a good addition. Reasonably priced for the rooms etc.

titulo: About what you'd expect for the price
conteudo: This is a v comfortable place - large rooms are set in 2-room bungalows in a well kept lush garden. There is something of a 'convention hotel' atmosphere to the main building. There is an excellent restaurant attached - serving absurdly enormous portions! - and a decent but expensive breakfast available. It is however a bit rich that the hotel charges you 13 euro to use the underground carpark beneath the hotel. This is a public parking space, but clearly managed/owned? by the hotel, and they should give guests free parking, not just a discounted rate. Service in the poolside bar was awful.

titulo: Lovely rooms in a tropical garden.
conteudo: All rooms form part of a cottage set in lush tropical gardens. There is a swimming pool, a spa (which we didn't have time to use) and it is just a few metres from the famous Jardins Huerta del Cura. We had planned to use the hotel as a base for exploring more widely around Murcia, but found Elche itself an interesting town so only made one longer excursion - to Murcia city.

titulo: Checked in yesterday and yet I am sorry I did!
conteudo:
I like this town: Elche is really a great city, easy to walk in, nice buildings and the palm tree groves have an interesting history lesson. But this hotel is definitely NOT what it promises to be, especially a four star! The grounds are very lovely, the pool area seems very nice and the menu I read at the main restaurant was promising. However the rooms need A LOT of improvement. I was in 135 and it was definitely only a 3 star. Once I was in my room I realized there were no English channels on TV (there are French channels and a few German but no English except CNBC! I was told there is something wrong with the TV channels today!) Maria at the reception was very nice to come to my room and make sure I could change the settings on the TV to English if there was an original English movie playing, (imagine that if I had not personally gone to the reception no one bothered to tell me, and if you change the channel you have to go through the whole process of changing the settings again) but the rest of the reception staff need some major training! Then the heater was not working! The AC unit sits on top of the armoire. And the guy who came to take care of it asked me if I needed cooling, when it is 10 degrees centigrade out! A real joker! Definitely not a 4 star hotel. The bathtub didn't drain when I took a shower, and the grout was somewhat moldy. Shame, the grounds are lovely, but the rooms are very basic. And it seems they don't care about making sure to check that everything is working before they check a client in. And the bed is not that comfortable. Plus if you have neighbors you hear everything.
There are no other 4 star hotels in Elche so they can get away with it, but definitely they have a long way to go to deserve that fourth star!

We stayed here for three nights recently. The hotel is low rise with en suite rooms in cottages in the garden. The rooms are a good size, quiet and well appointed. Pool area has plenty of seating in both sun and shade. Good breakfast and dinner.

titulo: Comfortable,quiet hotel in the middle of palm trees
conteudo: The hotel is a collection of chalets, each with four rooms, set in a grove of palm trees so it felt like living in a garden The rooms had excellent facilities and were quiet. The staff were friendly and helpful. The restaurant was excellent with a good range of dishes available and interesting wines. The hotel was across the road from an interesting palm garden and was convenient for exploring the town.

We stayed at the hotel for a wedding, the lobby was lovely and we thoroughly enjoyed the pool and grounds and thought the hotel room we were given was the perfect size for a family of 4. The bathroom was spacious, the family room had a small sitting area that fit a small couch and cot for the kids. However, the bed we adults slept in was basically two XL twin bed pushed together, which was a little odd to get used to. Breakfast was filling (a buffet with juice, coffee, toast, fruit, spreads etc.), the pool area was beautiful with palm trees and lots of chaise lounges.

Magnificent! An oasis of calm and peace in a lovely, vibrant city. Well placed for town centre, museums and palm forests. Bungalow traditionally and beautifully furnished with a lovely bathroom. Heating much appreciated at this time of year. Great breakfast beautifully presented. Staff polite and extremely helpful. Will return here hopefully in the summer when we can take advantage of the pool. Thank you, had a lovely time and would like to spend longer next time.

This hotel was our stop for the last night of our holiday. Next time it will be the first. The rooms are set in small bungalow type buildings in the grounds surrounded by hundreds of palm trees. It is so peaceful. I loved it and wished we could have stopped longer. Even the pool looked tempting although it was too cold to use. Breakfast at 10 euros was very good. The only downside was that apart from an American finance channel there was no English language news channel. However Richard Chamberlin dubbed into Spanish fascinating

Pretty bungalow type hotel set in a lush tropical setting. Rooms are comfortable and the hotel restaurant is quite good. The city center, shops, bars, restaurants, gardens and so much more are all a short stroll away yet one would never know once you are on the hotel grounds

We booked the Hotel Huerto Del Cura for one night with my Brother and Sister In Law to spend a couple of days in Elche. It took some time finding the hotel through Elches one way system. But once we arrived there we we‚Äôre completely and pleasantly surprised by the hotel layout. Private and safe parking at a reasonable cost right in front of the hotel reception. The rooms are lodge type wooden Chalets set in beautiful tropical gardens with a large swimming pool in amongst. The Hotel has all facilities required free WiFi,Restaurant Bars etc. Will definitely visit again in the summer and make use of the pool.

The first time i stayed in this hotel was back in 2007 / 2008, then another time in 2011, then the last time was in this year june 2017. I must say this hotel keeps improving and refreshing, re-newing their place. A nice pool, with a nice lounge part and bar. The rooms are still very big and comfortable. The palm trees and the garden are great to be a part of and the reception is always kind and helpful. I have a special bond with Elche and every time i go back i just want to stay in this hotel! Ow i almost forget, the breakfast always from a steady good quality. I just want to say keep up the good work and hopefully see you soon, regards from Holland!

This is the second visit to this charming hotel .loverly bungalow rooms which are a nice size with a well equipped bathroom . Good quality of bed linen and bath towels.
Enjoyable meal in the restaurant with a complimentary bottle of wine
All staff were excellent . Ample easy access Parking
A very enjoyable stay

Me & my husband stayed at Hotel Del Cura for 3 nights as we were in Elche for a wedding. There were a number of guests from our wedding party staying here for various amounts of time.

On our arrival to the hotel the staff at reception where very welcoming and friendly. As we were a few hours early for check in, they took our luggage and let us use the facilities until our room was ready. They took our mobile number and gave us a call when we could finish our check in and access our room. We were in our room a good few hours before the official check in time which was great!!

The little garden bungalows are very pretty and the rooms are lovely. They are well kept and cleaned daily. The gardens surrounding the hotel are beautiful!!

The swimming pool was lovely, cool at this time of year but when the sun really came up and it did reach 33 degrees on one of the days, we were grateful to get in and cool off!! It is possibly one of the deepest pools I have ever been in at the deep end. 2.5 meters (just over 8ft). Great for my husband who loves to jump/ dive in!! Nice and shallow at the other end though and a little pool next to it which was great for kids.

We had breakfast at the hotel each morning which was good and the staff were friendly and kept the place lovely and clean. There is a restaurant for lunch and dinner which looked nice but we didn't use these as we had places pre-booked.

There is a good variety of drinks at the outside bar and plenty of places to sit. Reasonably priced alcoholic drinks too. The pink strawberry gin appeared to be a favourite!!

Overall we had a lovely stay. We saw a couple of wedding receptions held here and the decoration was beautiful. We would definitely return!!

The strong points are the fantastic garden setting, very pleasant, and the rooms. My Junior Suite had lovely, refined wood & stone furniture and d√©cor. The same applies to the lobby.

On the down side, the ambiance is a bit like a package hotel. Not particularly clean, but OK, although one wonders if the floor is ever cleaned. Monday evening still the previous evening¬¥s room service trays and dirty laundry scattered around the place.

Most of all, it is not a peaceful hotel : parties, large groups, sounds from other rooms, in particular a lot of noise as of early in the morning from the gardeners, various workers, or, from the surrounding neighbourhood, loud crackers to scare birds and loudspeaker announcements & music.

The restaurant is nothing special, just convenient and benefiting from the hotel¬¥s splendid setting. Much better to be found elsewhere in Elche. Breakfast is OK, one can sit outdoors.

The car park is spacious enough, even with the daily receptions I could always find a spot late at night.

Overall, I would go back and recommend.

We stayed here for 3 nights while in the area, the hotel has a very relaxing feel to it and the palms throughout the grounds are quite amazing.
We found the room whilst a little dated very comfortable and spotlessly clean,we would definitely like to return here again one day and therefore would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.
.

We stayed only one night on business. This is a resort hotel with villas arranged around a garden setting. The rooms are very tired and outdated. The amenities in the room are more akin to 2 or, at best, 3 star standard.
My flight landed late so I arrived at the hotel after 1am. There were several other people checking in at the same time (they had probably arrived on the same flight). There was no-one to assist with luggage or to assist with finding my room, which was not easy to locate in the dark with the layout of the resort as it is.
The breakfast was very ordinary.
I wouldn't recommend this hotel unless you secure it at a bargain rate.
On a positive note, the pool area looked very pleasant.

We primarily wanted to visit the botanical palm gardens and needed a one night stay before moving on to the rest of our trip. An internet search brought back this result in Elche. We figured, yeah, sure, why not? How casual of us!!! What a beautiful hotel. Cabanas (each room is generally a quarter of the large cabana structure) were nicely tucked in among palm trees and well maintained gardens. Roomy, clean, comfortable accommodations and nicely private. Buffet breakfast is served in an amazing setting. The actual botanical garden Huerto del Cura (The Priest's Garden) is about 400 feet away. (That's another review.) The hotel's pool (not only the structure but the social activity around it) was energizing. Tables and chairs or reclining loungers were plentiful. Table-side or pool-side bar service was phenomenal. Rooms were generally well equipped but the WiFi service (essential in this digital age) was absolutely awesome. Enough range and bandwidth to allow us to watch uninterrupted Netflix movies to our hearts content. This place is truly a relaxing respite away from it all. The bar is open late and massage and facial treatments are available. The town of Elche was a great diversion. Great collection of eateries to satisfy the gastronomic cravings for most if not all. A great social scene at night but remember, it starts late as is the custom in Spain. WE WILL BE BACK!!!

The hotel is well situated and the fact that bedrooms are in little bungalows makes it all. The bedroom was spacious and soundproof ( a wedding took place when we were there and we didnt hear any music..) . The breakfast was also very nice. The down sides are people and transats by the swimming pool ( but hotel cant do anything about people reserving them and not being there the all day) and the very expensive car park : 13‚Ç¨ per day ( although there is plenty of free parking in the narrow street of Elche if you don't mind a short walk). I would have liked to have a free bottle of water in the bedroom as it would be what I expect from a 4* hotel. Very nice place for a long weekend as only 20 min away from Alicante airport.

We spent two nights here in July as we were attending a wedding function. Most of our time here was taken up with things associated with the wedding and we didn't really get to enjoy the place to the full extent. However, the wedding and reception afterwards was perfect and the hotel made sure everything ran smoothly and efficiently.

A perfect setting for a perfect wedding with all the amenities to hand. The staff, the layout, the wedding arrangements were all spot on along with the food and drink.

Definitely recommended but a word of advice....spend more than two days here to really enjoy the hotel to the fullest.

Went into hotel for a drink and looked around gardens etc. Everything was so well set out, great place to hold weddings etc. Very clean, staff very helpful and polite. Would reccommend to friends and family.
origem: Newcastle upon Tyne, England, United Kingdom

conteudo: We have recently celebrated our daughter's wedding at the hotel. We could not have chosen a more perfect venue. The staff could not do enough to make the occasion as amazing as it was, they went above and beyond what we expected from them. The hotel itself has beautiful gardens and a lovely peaceful vibe. The canapes served after the wedding ceremony and the food at the reception was first class; we also ate breakfast at the hotel the morning after the wedding and, again, couldn't fault it. We stayed in a family room with our two grandchildren; the room consisted of a huge bedroom with king size bed and an adjoining room with twin beds and a sofa. The room was spotless and simply, but stylishly decorated. A huge thank you to all the staff and also to the lovely Eva who conducted the wedding ceremony so beautifully. We will certainly be returning in the future!

What a beautiful resort.The grounds are very lush,green and well tended.The whole place,including the rooms spotlessly clean. Very comfortable beds.Friendly staff.We spent 3 nights there and relaxed completely. Even though it was high season there were enough sunbeds. It would have been a nice touch if a few sunbeds had been situated around the gardens,away from the pool,as well as around the pool.Elche is an interesting town.If you can tear yourself away from the hotel,take a look at the Huerto del Cura Garden diagonally opposite.Have relaxing walks in the palm groves,and also see the lovely Santa Maria Basilica. Thank you Hotel Huerto del Cura. We certainly hope to return some day soon.

An amazing place. Very tranquil and calm. Went with another close friend. We had a beautiful villa. Walk-in shower. Double basins. Towels are provided in the rooms. Pay a 10euro deposit at Reception and you can get a towel for the pool area. Paying 10euro at reception also pays for a lovely buffet brekkie. Hot pastries. Hot food. Continental. Pool is exceptional and clean. So refreshing following temps of 30deg+!! Take a left out of the hotel and about 10 mins walk is the supermarket Hiperber. Bought water, crisps/snacks, fruit and milk. Took my own travel kettle as love a cuppa in the morning and tea for our afternoon siesta! We went at the end of July. It was very quiet. There were a couple of weddings at the hotel, but this did not disturb our time. We went for peace. Read books. Listen to music and chill. We did that and more. The town is stunning too. Loads of restaurants and water fountains. Oh, bags and shoes..oh my....so beautiful and so cheap!!! A place we will definitely go back to. Well done Hotel del Cura - couldn't find a fault!!!

We stayed two nights in a bungalow under the Palm trees. Nice and clean room with bathroom, no kitchen or private outside area. Friendly Staff. Good restaurent and poolarea. Very close to Alicante AirPort.

I stayed 2 nights at this hotel with my daughter and was very impressed. We didn't want to tour Elche so we spent our time at the hotel and were not disappointed. The layout of the hotel with room blocks around the garden and sheltered by the wonderful palm trees works very well. The room was simply but stylishly decorated and a very good size. We ate both nights in the hotel restaurant - once outside by the pool and once inside. The food is to a very good standard but possibly a little overpriced for the quality. The wine list is good and very reasonably priced. We wanted to lie by the pool and read books all day and we were able to do so in pretty good comfort. The only big downside is that the loungers are too close together and no umbrellas - which in August is not ideal at all. The pool is great - very deep (up to 2.6m) and a good size so doesn't feel too crowded. Overall very good service and friendly staff. If you need a good quality bolt hole near Alicante airport (20 mins drive away) before heading home after a holiday in the area I'd highly recommend this hotel.

This hotel is such a gem. Stayed here for 5 nights, leaving tomorrow. It is incredibly relaxing, the staff are lovely and very helpful, the town is just a few minutes walk with lots of shops and restaurants. The food is pricey at the hotel and adds up if your staying for a while but it is lovely. People thought we were in the Caribbean from the pictures, I can't wait to come back!!

We stayed here for 7 nights and it was wonderful. Lovely palm trees everywhere, very relaxing. Staff are friendly and helpful. We would stay here again if we are back in Elche that's for sure. Thanks for a lovely week

I have just landed back in the UK. I am missing Huerto del Cura already. It's very relaxing, the food is lovely, the staff is friendly, the rooms are nice and the palm trees are amazing. I can't wait to go back. This is a little piece of heaven hidden away in elche, I don't think anything could of mad our trip better. It is mainly Spanish but they cater for other languages, the palm tree orchid next door is a must see it's so tranquil. I will defiantly visit again and have recommended Huerto del Cura to al my family and friends

We stayed only one night sadly, but made the most of a late check out. As others have said, rooms are bungalow style, arranged around beautiful palms and bougainvillea. We found both rooms to be clean and modern. Reception was friendly and efficient, and the poolside bar was amazing!
The pool is the star, it's kept very clean and there are plenty of sun beds and shady areas too. Easy stroll into the centre of Elche. Breakfast is very nice, but a short stroll to the placa de la glorieta, brings you to several lovely cafes to enjoy toast and coffee at a fraction of the price.
To conclude this is a great hotel, good value for money and I heartily recommend.

This is the letter I wrote to the manager to which I have had absolutely no response

Dear Sir/Madam,

Please forgive me for writing in English, my Spanish is quite poor to express myself concisely, although as I live in Spain and I do speak Spanish. I have attached a google translated version below for your information.

Having just returned from your hotel today, after visiting the wonderful La Finca Restaurant nearby yesterday evening, I would just like to comment that I found your hotel a huge disappointment. As a ‚Äúfour star‚Äù rated hotel, I personally found the rating, description and photographs of the hotel to be very misleading and contrary to my expectations.

As a guest and architect, I found the hotel quite run down. The reception and restaurant areas were relatively acceptable but the rooms were a huge disappointment. The beds were comfortable, clean and fresh but I doubt that the bathrooms would even qualify for a two star rating with a rusty leaky radiator, loose taps, dirty grouting and a disappointing atmosphere overall.

I¬¥m alway one to give positive feedback, as I have done to many hotels and restaurants, but I¬¥m sad to say that on this occasion, with your hotel at least, I was very disappointed. I think my friends staying next door would also agree.

I live in an Urbanisation called Villa Gadea in Altea. We have a hotel adjoining, by the same name. It is a five star and cost merely ‚Ç¨28 per night more than I have paid at your Hotel (also including breakfast) It is however in a totally different league!!

I could mention other minor disappointments, like the fridge didn't¬¥t work and a heap of other things but I¬¥ll just attach a few photographs for you to see and decide for yourself.

Thanking you for your attention.

Kind regards, from some very disappointed customers.

We chose Elche as a convenient overnight stop to break-up our drive from Cordoba to Valencia. After passing on a standard room (small, stark and unappealing) and on a superior (larger, stark and unappealing) room -- we upgraded to a wonderful Jr Suite. Spacious, well-appointed, with a luxurious large bathroom. The grounds are beautiful: big swimming pool, palm trees, flowering birds of paradise, winding brick walkways. Very good breakfast

I stayed in Elche for one night and chose Huerto del Cura as it fit well with the aesthetic I was after, I had spent two nights in Puerto de Alicante, Postiguet where the town is always hustle and bustle and really appreciated the calm of Elche.

The hotel is walking distance from town approx 5 minutes.

The grounds are spacious and green, the facilities are all very environmentally friendly.

Breakfast is alright I've had better but consists of meats and cheeses, pastries, eggs both scrambled and boiled, fruits, veg & cereals.

The upstairs rooms in the bungalows have bath tubs and the ground floors have wet rooms.

The televisions are hidden in a wooden wardrobe in every room and can be opened and closed at your leisure.

Every room has air conditioning which is vital on a warm summers night/day.

The swimming pool is quite deep, there's a children's pool which is 0.5 metres. The lowest height in the main pool is about 1.18 metres and as usually gradually gets deeper.

There's a restaurant onsite and also a terrace, I didn't use either unfortunately.

I also didn't use their spa facility but can only imagine how gorgeous it would have been.

Huerto del Cura is definitely a little bit of heaven on earth.

I will definitely be back!

Great location - friendly staff and helpful nice palms and gardens set off with a good swimming pool. Great quality food in a nice setting - nice base outside of Alicante close to town with shops and restaurants

Visited here for our 26th wedding anniversary and had a great time the hotel is lovely and the staff were really good especially Jesus who I think is the restaurant manager we had some small issues but they were dealt with swiftly and professionally if I had one small criticism it would be the romantic package which my husband booked for our special occasion I would have expected cava on arrival in the room and fluffy bathrobes and a secluded table for dinner as I felt there was nothing romantic about it but the food was lovely so I'm not complaining would definatley go again

We had a great experience, a peaceful place surrounded by exotic vegetation
Amazing dinner, and the people at reception very nice and ready to help
Us in everything we need, rooms are spacious and clean, the buffet breakfast is very good and we had it outdoors by the pool
Definitely we will return.

titulo: Peaceful hotel amongst the palm trees
conteudo:
I stayed here for 5 nights in late February with my elderly father. We had 2 rooms next door to each other in the lush hotel gardens. The rooms were lovely with a simple, but practical design and were very comfortable.

Breakfast was excellent with choices to suit all tastes. We dined here 4 times during our stay. The restaurant is sumptuous and definitely fine dining with delicious regional dishes, served by attentive waiters.

Elche is a lovely city and this hotel is the perfect tranquil base from which to explore it. Highly recommended!

Our friends held their wedding reception here and we stayed overnight. The hotel has an unrivalled location in a palm forest in the centre of Elche, we were welcomed with cocktails and canapes around the pool - perfect. Later we ate dinner inside and there was the usual disco afterwards. The service was excellent at all times. The accommodation is in the form of cabins in the grounds, not luxurious, but fine, the gardens are lovely to wander around the next day.

Location ‚Äì The hotel is located slightly outside the town centre in a palm orchard, beautiful setting! Two or three minutes walking to the nearest supermarket, then five minutes to the town centre. It‚Äôs also easy walking to the bus station and trains, and even immediately next to the hotel there are caf√©s and little shops.
Rooms ‚Äì Our rooms were in a block away from the pool area, near to the Spa Zen Garden. It was a bit of a labyrinth to get to the room but it‚Äôs a beautiful setting. The room was big with all the things you need, wardrobe, desk, chairs, hairdryer, toiletries, safe. We had to search for the plugs though for our electricals! The walls have pictures of palm trees to go with the theme, and our room got the sun in the morning so it kept cool all day. With the big shutter pulled as well it was really comfy to sleep in.
Facilities ‚Äì We used the pool and the spa. You can hire towels at reception for 10‚Ç¨ deposit which is returned when you give your towel back. The loungers were comfy by the pool, and you could easily move them around in and out of the shade. The pool is also very clean and there‚Äôs a life guard on weekends. We also enjoyed the chill-out area next to the bar, comfy outdoor sofas in the shade and table service for a refreshing sangria!
Food ‚Äì We didn‚Äôt have breakfast here, but we did have some lunches, the sandwiches were really nice and the accompanying cocktails were so refreshing. They also do crisps and olives as bar snacks which was great for lazing round the pool in the sun!
Staff ‚Äì Everyone was very friendly but they did do the old Spanish trick of not letting you pay for things (taking ages to accept that you wanted the bill, then taking ages to bring it).

titulo: Third Visit and surpassed even the past two visits for excellent gourmet food
conteudo: We went for half board this time as the food last time was so excellent. We were not disappointed - it was absolutely superb! The chefs here are Michelin standard for sure. Fish, meat all excellently cooked and top notch presentation. On top of pleasant grounds comfortable bungalows this is a superior hotel and worth a visit. Very good access for disabled too

We were pleasantly surprised by the luxury of this resort tucked in the palm groves of Elche. The location is not far from city center, shops, and restaurants. The rooms are very comfortable and they provide very nice, welcoming touches. I would consider this a luxury facility however the price at the time of our stay was mid-range.

Great property in the middle of Palm forest. Very close to Jardin Huerto del Cura. We had a very nice bungallo. The territory is absolutely splendid.
The breakfast was delicious. I regret I didn't go to the restaurant. It opens at 9pm, which was late for me (restaurants in generally open late in Spain).
Very long check-in process, which was a turn-off after a long ride.

titulo: Very good location, attractive gardens, bungalows could be better
conteudo: The location was just right, obviously very close to the Jardin Huerto del Cura, the most attractive of all Elche's palm gardens, and a short walk from the historic centre. The hotel gardens are very well kept, and the whole setting is appealing, though less appreciated in mid-winter. We were somewhat disappointed to find, as we first entered the bungalow, a damp smell. We managed to counter this by using the very effective heating system. I am not sure it is a good idea for the bungalows to become covered with climbing and creeping plants, when there are already many trees and shrubs close to them. Service was helpful (a leaking basin was quickly attended to, though unsuccessfully), but I cannot comment further as we did not have either breakfast or dinner there.

Traveling w/o reservations, we basically dropped our finger in the center of Elche's palmeral and contacted this hotel. We knew nothing at all about the experience we were about to have. We arrived after searching the entire city [not because the hotel is hard to find, but because we arrived during a major festival that had the east side of the town cordoned off to traffic] and were quite surprised to enter through the stately gates to the private parking. The main hotel is smartly decorated and stylishly designed. The 'hotel lodgings' are out back, in the jungle, little bungalows that have 2-4 bedrooms with separate entrances. There must be 20+ bungalows scattered throughout the gardens. Our room was in the second bungalow. Except for neighboring noises that found their way through the walls, the room provided all our needs very nicely. We felt at home here, a warm light at the end of a pleasant garden path marked the place for peace and comfort.

I joke about the jungle out back only because one cannot prepare themselves for the transition to such a lush, verdant, exotic oasis as the Hotel Huerto del Cura gardens present to their guests. Across the street is the 'jewel of the palmeral', El Huerto del Cura national artistic gardens [go], but frankly, they have only a botanical leg up on the Hotel Huerto del Cura. The Hotel arrangement of pool, bar, cafeteria, restaurant and bungalows within their palm forest is perfect. The effect is Eden. The care and variety of the vegetation and garden grounds is exceptional.

The natural environment sets this hotel apart, but their restaurant makes a stay here an added pleasure. We dined here each night to superb food and drink, elegance, and expert service.

We are sooooooo glad to have discovered the Hotel Huerto del Cura. We will stop in Elche again, just to stay here.

This isn't strictly speaking a 'hotel'. It's a collection of cabins around some lovely gardens. That said, it is lovely. The rooms are ok, basic but comfy bed and nice bathroom but my group booked 3 separate rooms and two of them smelled a little musty. We went to the restaurant for dinner which was a bit weird, nobody finished their food, it was a bit too 'edgy' for us and I would class myself as pretty adventurous.

This is not a traditional hotel but a series of well-spaced cabins set in a UNESCO world heritage site of impressive palm trees. The accommodation is relatively simple and slightly dated but clean and comfortable. The gardens make it stand out from usual hotels.

Good and varied breakfast choices in poolside setting and excellent restaurant in the main building.

A memorable retreat.

we were there as a group of eight. we had lovely tapas for starters, perfect meat as main course and desert to indulge. the wine suited the dinner very well. staff was very attentive. the interior was laid back elegance. overall my
best elche dinner experience.

Well designed spacious room in beautiful garden, Nice outside bar and swimming pool and good restaurant.
Garden, room and facilities all expres a quiet and relaxed atmosphere.
Service in restaurant can be improved.

Stayed here for two nights at the end of our vacation this summer... The way from the coast makes you think Where is this road taking me?, but when you finally arrive to the hotel, it feels like you arrived to a small paradise. The check-in was smooth and friendly, the bungallows are really cute, very clean and optimal for a shorter stay. The gardens are just incredibly well kept, beautiful green all over... The pool zone is maximum chill, if you dont have kids jumping in-out of the water. We had dinner one night, ordered the degustation menu, which was good but not really worth it. The waiters do not speak english really, so it was super hard to get most of our orders right. We waited super long for our bill, but it never came so after a while we left, nobody bothered. The next day at check-out we found some items on our bill we never even consumed, plus the menu card says the set price includes taxes and charges, but the bill added additional taxes on it, what nobody could explain what it really was. The receptionist was super rude, she did not seem helpful with the invoicing or explaining additional charges at all...too bad I forgot her name, she could use some guest service training.

Stayed for one nite to attend friends wedding reception. Checked in earlier that day enjoyed spending some time by the pool even though it was a bit cold. The setting is amazing little bungalows doted around the gardens. The room itself was very beautiful with a large bed and plenty of room. Good air conditioning. The wedding reception was amazing. The food was gorgeous, the setting was very beautiful one of the nicest weddings have ever been to, every little detail was lovely. The disco was fab. Checking in and out straight forward staff very nice. Would definitely visit again

titulo: Happy to get away from English summer!
conteudo: Beautiful clean rooms, lovely pool. Pleasant staff. The locals are the people you want to speak to the locals they love the footy, it's great to have a conversation with them and have a bit of banter even with the the language barrier with food you can say it all with expression

titulo: A we'll run hotel in a lovely location
conteudo: The rooms, being in detached bungalows, are peaceful and you are amidst palms and shrubs in a well kept garden. Our sitting room and separate bedroom were spacious and the bathroom modern. This is a well run hotel, parking is easy, although a charge is made, and the breakfast and dinner very good. Elche is an interesting city, and the hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the centre.

Stayed here for 5 nights with my partner, a beautiful hotel with a lovely pool and night time setting, cute little rooms too, Ensure you scrub up on your english as a lot of the staff couldn't speak english, The room size was good, the bed was a little uncomfortable, I also found they didn't have a great choice of food if you are a fussy eater like me! and I have to say the cocktails were not great... Service was a little slow but all staff were friendly, Not in the best location either, the city centre is a little rough and not much choice for food and shops... but a nice little getaway.

Our booking was messed up , they blamed booking.com , the poolside service was diabolical , the waitresses were over worked , understaffed and moody , and when we left got charged more due to their principle booking mistake and they had no idea how to resolve the problem , just a joke , first time
I've ever felt the need to complain about anywhere on this app

This is not like a normal hotel, but bungalows in between the palm trees, you feel you are away from the town not in the middle of it. The bungalows are spacious and cleaned every day. The rooms are quiet. Whilst we were here for 5 days, there were 3 weddings, but we were not bothered by any noise. This is a beautiful place to stay, and the pool is surrounded by palm trees so you have shade if needed. The buffet breakfast is very good with all sorts of choice.
The staff are very friendly and helpful. The lunches and cocktails are great. We had one meal here and it was beautiful, compliments to the chef. We would recommend you eat here.
I would certainly stay here again, we had a great five days here, thank you to all the Staff.

titulo: Ideal stop away from the tourist trail.
conteudo: Set amongst the palm trees of the Palmeral it is a perfect setting away from the usual tourist haunts. Their prize possession is the swimming pool and poolside restaurant for dinner and breakfast. We had a problem in that the air con would not switch off but I'm sure that that was an isolated incident. Car parking good but cost 13‚Ç¨.

The best thing about the Hotel Huerto del Cura is that it does not look like a hotel. It is a collection of small bungalows spread around an oasis of palm trees and other plants. Located in front of the garden Huerto del Cura and close to Elche's city centre, you can not beat its location. Moreover the staff are nice and helpful!
The only drawback preventing me from giving it a 5 star rating is the quality of the rooms, which are a little bit basic for this price range

titulo: An oasis of good taste in elche (elx)
conteudo:
When we stay in Torrevieja we like to get away from the big crowds and the tuna fish salad to experience the spanish atmosphere. Elx is only a 40 min drive and has plenty of good restaurants, culture and great hotels to offer. One of this gems is the hotel del cura.

You can park your car for 10 euro at the doorstep and use your room key card to get in and out of the parking lot if needed. You can rent a buje for 10 euro a day or 2 euro for 1 hour.
An other extra is the 10 euro for breakfast which is fair: plenty of pastries, fruits, hams (all with an s so different kinds), cheeses (with an s), salmon, fruitjuices (s), cava, yoghurt, eggs(s), ... great value for your money and you can have bf outside. Which accentuates the holiday feeling.

The cocktails and drinks are reasonably prised and the bar closes round 1 (weekdays).

We took a smaller/ cheaper room so don t look at the pictures on their website if you don t take a more expensive cabin... they are smaller but you got everything you need. It s clean and comfortable and the airco works fine. Can somebody just change the lamps above the beds it ruins the romantic moments (i can get you a discount and give advice).

But the main character in this story is for the central part of the hotel. The swimming pool, the palm trees, the architecture which is quite exotic (how do you mean we re in a city center in spain) and combines a luxourious setting with great taste. At night with the bulbs and lamps it feels cosy and romantic.

The hotel is easy accesible and near the city center. It only takes a few minutes to get to local and some classy restaurants and pubs even michelin rewarded restaurants.
